The Poutine a la Schwartz's was just as satisfying. When topped with hot gravy and fresh cheese curds, this classic side of fries is transformed into a mini meal. What Schwartz's serves is simple, unadulterated comfort food. Do yourself a favor and indulge for your next cheat meal. Your soul will thank you for it!

Great smoked meat, but kinda overrated.FOOD: 4/5The quality of their smoked meat itself is great. Not so crazy about it in a sandwich. The bread they use is thin and breaks easily when eating, making this meal kinda messy. The mustard is also a little on the light side and I hardly tasted it. SERVICE: 4/5We came here two years ago during the holidays and waited about 30 minutes in the takeout side for a sandwich. We were lucky this came, came around 6pm on a Tuesday evening and no line at all! The employees aren't the most friendly and they're a bit pushy on you giving tips even if you're getting takeout (and already paying a whopping $11 for a sandwich).It's okay if there's no line up but if you have to wait to get a sandwich, I'd probably consider some of the other great food options nearby.

Long lines and delicious food. Nothing beats Schwartz on a Montreal road trip. Skip the line and do the take out, it serves an equally tasty, melt in your mouth, spicy mustard complimented, juicy meat sandwich. This is my Montreal road trip ritual and guilty pleasure. Smoked meat is a staple in Montreal and I am a total sucker for it. It never disappoints and is extremely affordable. My advice is either order a coleslaw or pickle if you want a side dish and dining in...AND DO NOT DENY the force of the meat sandwich. ORDER 1, 2, 50!! Obviously until you are full. The meat sandwich is the star!!
Amazing place. No problem driving from ottawa to Montreal for Swartz. Great smoke meat sandwiches. Fries delicious. We bought a jar of pickles and a pack of meat.Amazing place

Did you know people eat smoke meats at 10:30am? Is this consider a brunch or lunch? Well, whatever you call it, it is worth the wait. It was a busy place, a little slow but they are busy. It took a while before they take our order but the food came fast. We enjoyed it so much with a big plate of fat meat and a plate of medium fat meat. We made our own sandwiches and it was delicious. The fries were freshly made; large pickle - I find it very sour; coleslaw was really good together with our sandwiches. This place was so famous that we saw tour guide bought it and share with the tourists just outside the store. So if you do join a tour visit passing Montreal, asked them if there is a visit at Swartz~~

I mean it lives up to the legend.  You either love it and embrace it or you go to Reubens and just let it be :)The sandwiches are expectly alcsrved. The mustard perfectly balances the meat to the rye...just a. Perfect bite.Yum

Came here because we heard it was super famous. The line was very very long when I came around lunchtime. But we did manage to skip the line a little bit, by ordering from the seperate "to go" store. It's right next to the original restaurant. I waited in line maybe 15 mins. You would just order your sandwich, then wait in line to pay for it. I got the smoked meat. I thought the sandwich was a little dry. The meat was a little dry. I really liked the sauce but I wish there was more. Portion sizes were big, there was a lot of meat stuffed into one sandwich. I wouldn't wait in line for an hour for it though.

Most famous deli meat sandwich place in Montreal. The meat is so juicy and made with just enough spices so it's not too much and not too salty. It is served so well with pickles ! Must go and try at least once -- but I'll tell you now, you will fall in love with it!

Hard to choose a place to eat with so many great spots around but hearing the history about this place made it a must stop. Meat was cooked to perfection and juicy and super tasty, only thing i wish was that the bread they gave you it on was bigger, i understand its more about the meat but when you have a giant pile of meat with a piece of bread thats gone in one bit thats a bit dissapointing. Happy i went and will be back again but maybe next time get my own bread and buy the meat by the pound!

When in Montreal... Must have Montreal Smoked meat!1) The line goes very fast, but if you don't want to wait, the store / deli to left does take out only and faster than the dine in restaurant.  Dine in is also a fast turn over, but gives you a better experience.  Most likely be seated in communal table.  2) Order the smoked meat! With side of pickles and poutine.  You wont regret it.   3) Enjoy! Service is fast & friendly, food is very good!

Yay! I'm a fan.Every time I am in Montreal, this is my one of many stop. It's a must! I am drooling just by the thought of their smoked meats. Even when my friends are in Montreal, I'll ask them to bring some back for me. It's worth it.It is a must-try when you're in Montreal. The line for dine-in is ridiculously long but the take-out is quick. Ultimately it is up to you.They take everything from cash, debit and credit.They'll charge you a fee for bags.

Had to try to place since everyone raves about it. I had he smoked meat sandwich, a pickle, and the Schwartz poutine. The sandwich was alright. It wasn't amazing, I don't think I would crave it although it was definitely good. I've just had better sandwiches and I don't think I would stand in line again in the cold just for the sandwich. The poutine, though, was outstanding. I had my bite within seconds of it being placed on the counter and I bit into delish crunchy, savory, smoky heaven. Wow. This is a dish I will definitely remember.

SO good, and totally worth the long line (which goes fast, they seated our party of 6 under 10 mins). The restaurant is tiny and diner-style, and after taking a bite of their smoked meat sandwich I understand why the restaurant is so famous. Definitely recommend getting poutine and a pickle on the side! This is a must go-to when visiting Montreal. The only downside is cash only. I didn't have to use an ATM on this week long trip until I came here. They have an ATM in the restaurant though
It was good. Not as good as what I expected tho. The line was long and we were hungry. Buy The meat was little bit dry.

Smoked meat sandwich. Absolutely flawless.Yes it's touristy. Yes everyone orders the same thing. But when the smoked meat sandwich is perfection, why wouldn't you?10/10 would recommend and definitely go again.The only part I may pass on is the pickle, we had both the pickle and the coleslaw and the coleslaw was better. For pickle connoisseurs this was a full sour, traditional deli pickle. I always prefer half Sour with a bit more crunch.

Old-school, no-frills (in fact, cash-only) Jewish deli in the heart of Montreal. A popular spot for tourists -- and locals -- and well-earned, because their smoked meat (house-made pastrami) sandwich is probably the best I've ever had. Lively without being crowded, and friendly service, too.

My first time having Schwartz's was so damn good. I got the smoked meat sandwich and the meat was thinly sliced and some pieces were lean, and some were fatty. I was sharing with my friend and I think afterwards, we both wished we ordered our own. I never thought I would be a smoked meat person but that was because I never ate Schwartz's! The meat was tender and flavorful. The mustard completed the sandwich. Someone ahead of me had ordered a sandwich without mustard which now appalls me but to each their own. I wish I had a pickle but I guess that's for sit-down only?

I honestly don't get the hype of Schwartz's pastrami sandwich. Yes, the place is PACKED and infamous. If you don't mind cramped seating where you'll be sharing a long table with strangers and a very hectic environment where the servers are running around and the men behind the meat counters are shouting out orders, it could be an enjoyable experience. It's CASH only here though, and there is an ATM machine located in the back but I think they charged a higher ATM fee so I decided to go outdoors where I somehow heard getting cash was easier. AVOID the sketchy outdoor ATM machine covered in graffiti in front of a nearby book(?) store. It looks deceivingly functional since the light is on. You need to go inside the convenience store along the same street and they have an ATM there.Finally after getting the cash, we ordered three regular sandwiches which come on thinly sliced rye bread with some mustard and a decent amount of pastrami. Maybe it's because I haven't had much pastrami in my life but the meat wasn't amazing or memorable. None of us thought it was that great. Just a plain sandwich in my opinion. The tables were kinda dirty and the tap water didn't look so hygienic either.

First of all i would like to warn everybody that they only accept cash or Canadian debit card. There is no sign outside you would only understand when you go to cashier to pay your bill!!! And also if you want to pay with US dollar they charge you another %20 , even though US dollar exchange rate is higher.  The meat sandwich is little above average, i have eaten 1000 times better at Nusret Burger, and they accept CREDIT CARD.

Amazing sandwiches!! A must try if you're in Montreal and if you're a meat-lover! It's like the Katz deli in NYC. I got the smoked meat sandwich (there aren't that many options, at least as far as we understood the french menu). We got cole slaw and pickles as sides. The reason I gave four stars is that their sandwiches have nothing on the side, not even a pickle. And the inside is so small, really disproportionate to the line outside!! I understand they want to keep the authentic interior but they should have expanded in some way with the money they're making. We tried the poutine as well and it was ok (not a huge poutine fan in general).

I would give Schwartz's a 10-star review if I can! I live in Toronto & that was the first time I try Montreal's smoked meat. Best decision ever! They make sure that the sandwich is reaaallllyyyy packed with them fatty smoked brisket! Cannot wait til my next time in Montreal to immerse myself in this meaty meal!!

Three words: worth  the  hype. Easily the best pastrami sandwich I've ever had! We got there at an off time around 4PM and we were seated right away at the counter. A line began to form as we were finishing up so just be prepared to wait. The fries were super crispy and their signature cherry soda was perfectly refreshing. I will definitely be back!

Been to Monteal many times, but never had the time to make it here, but on my last trip, I just had to make the time.And when I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't busy and I had the whole bar section pretty much all to myself.And as for the sandwich itself, that smoked meat had a lot of flavors. Pickle paired well too.Montreal is known for smoked meat. And you can pretty much get it anywhere...but you need to get here as well. It's pretty good.

Excellent meat, and speed. Welcome to smoke meat heaven!! They are quick. You ask for the smoke meat sandwich. They hand it to you in literally seconds.  I would say it's one of the best smoke meat you can get in town. As a sandwich, it could be better since bread was cold. But the peppery and hot rendered fat tasted great. Slices were not too thin. Very tender and meaty. Sides are ok at best. Slaw was watery and mushy. But, the meat more than makes up for the weak bread and watery slaw. It's THAT GOOD! For $10 it's a better good deal. Compared to Katz, I'll gladly pay half the price for an excellent smoke meat sandwich for a smaller portion size.Excellent service staff with some delightful convos. FYI cash only.

A bit embarrassing that it took me up till now to finally visit Schwartz's, but better late than never.Aside from the standard fresh light rye bread and regular mustard on top, it all comes down to the meat. I was fortunate enough be be accompanied by a Schwartz's veteran who asked that we get medium fat. Glad we did as the experience was amazing. You risk thinking coming in that the place could be over-hyped by virtue of being an institution, but it really isn't. They apparently made people happy as far back as 90 years ago, and they're still putting smiles on faces and stuffing bellies of today's hipsters, foodies and everyone else in between.The meat is fantastic quality. The medium fat is not fatty per say and you don't risk getting chunks of gristle; it really just adds some taste and juiciness. I was quite pleased by how fresh it was and I also wasn't aware of how peppery it was, which was to my delight. Of course there's copious amounts of meat that you'd never typically want elsewhere normally, but for this quality and experience, it's well worth it. In fact, considering that it's quality beef brisket, you could argue there's some terrific value you get for what must be a half pound of meat.I ordered the made in house pickle and coleslaw. It would've been nice to be able just to be able to order a smaller side of each just to pair with the sandwich as I ended up paying about $6-7 to get a large side of coleslaw and a full-sized pickle - but the price for what you get is fair.The service is quick and functional, but I have to say our guy was super-friendly and not the grumpy type that I was told to expect here at all.I've heard from others and seen other reviews that there are alternatives to Schwartz's to go to so that you can avoid the hype and lines. I'm not so convinced as I really felt I experienced the gold standard in smoked meat sandwiches here. Everyone else should at least visit once before considering as substitution, because I'm not so sure it truly exists.
Also good for a late night snack, simple and delicious! Line ups are always crazy long but worth it for a quick bite

What can I say that hasn't been said? If you're weird about personal space or sitting by strangers, this isn't the place for you, but if you're lucky, you'll get sat beside some nice strangers and enjoy a delicious meal together. We split a small sandwich and our first poutine here. 10/10 must do in Montreal and the line went much quicker than we had thought it would!

absolute worst sandwich ever. price is crazy for two pieces of dry bread, a hint of mustard and some oily "smoked" meat that is completely tasteless. the poutine is also the worst we've ever tried, the sauce was questionable.... especialy the texture. it wasn't fresh at all. and also can we talk about the service and location? the place is not appealing at all. i love small restaurants that are not fancy but wow that place was almost disgusting. big buckets exposed near the cash.. empty shelves and untouched surfaces..... maybe it was once THE place to have smoke meat... now it's just a sad place and turist trap

Literally the best smoked meat I have ever had.  The sandwiches are FULL of the meat and man, are they tasty! Getting a bite with a bit or fat filled your mouth with so much flavour! The meat is incredibly well seasoned and sandwiches are dressed with mustard. Quintessential Montreal food ladies and gentlemen. Not worth going to Montreal without going to Schwartz's! Also there are lines, but there is a sit down restaurant and a to go restaurant, so if you're ok with just the highly recommended original sandwich, just take out.Can't wait to go again!!!

Yep, checked this place off my list. Not sure if I'm too critical but it's really nothing to rave about. Went there on Monday lunch and the line was out the door. We just drove 3.5 hrs from Quebec City so we were in no moods to wait for the table. We decided to just order Togo, which was no lines at all. We ordered 2 smoked meat sandwiches (3/5)- I may not be a big fan of sandwiches but the meat was just ok. It served on the smallest piece of bread which made it kind of hard to eat. French fries (2/5)- just tasteless, not very crunchy on the outside. Overall, I'm glad we have an opportunity to check it off the list but personally not worth the time to wait in line

There is something special about Schwartz's. It's the atmosphere, the energy, and of course, the food. My favourite spot to sit is at the counter. I am of the belief that the best smoked meat spots in this city are all special for different reasons, and Shwartz's smoked meat lives up to its reputation. Be prepared with some napkins, because this bad boy is going to fall apart on you in the best way possible.

Gave them all my money for a pile of food that is sure to give me a heart attack. 10/10 would do it again.The takeout line is much shorter than the sitting line, so we opted for takeout and hung with the most charismatic guys behind the counter you can imagine. They steered me away from ordering turkey (nothing but smoked meat when you come here baby) and laughed at our future food coma when we topped it off with poutine and a pickle. All of it was epic. Assuming my arteries survive this meal I'm going back for more.

SCHWARTZ'S IS A MUST-TRY WHEN IN MONTREAL! I have to give this place a 5/5 for how damn good the smoked meat sandwiches are. I highly recommend pairing the smoked meat sandwiches with fries and a pickle! The pickle is a nice complement to the heavy amount of meat in the sandwich. The fries are also a delicious side and are delicious when first served.  It is a typical dirty diner, so it's a very casual. The prices are reasonable for the quantity and quality of food. The service is EXTREMELY fast. We got seated within 10 minutes while they were packed. Most people stay here for about 30-45 minutes, so it is definitely a quick meal. You also pay for your check at the front of the restaurant!

Always a true delight. The long lines and super busy atmosphere inside can be intimidating but both are worth. Stay simple and get the smoked meat sandwich which comes with a bit of mustard. One sandwich is basically a meal in itself, it's quite filling. The dill pickles are pretty tasty, too, as is the poutine. It's got its deli next door, where you can also order the sandwich, and the atmosphere is quieter.
Great place to stop for a sandwich. Line is a bit long but the sandwich is worth the wait!

Schwartz's lives up to the hype! In fact, you won't miss this place if you're passing by because there's always a huge line! The location is perfect, as it's nestled on one of Montreal's most lively streets (and was a stone's throw from my Airbnb). I had the classic - a Montreal smoked meat sandwich with a pickle on the side. The meat was succulent and delicious, and the pickle was perfectly sour, just like it should be.
This is the real deal smoked meat and poutine in Montreal.  Sadly, I've tried a lot of them.

This place is an absolute gem! The food is out of this world and the staff is some of the friendliest people I have ever met. They immediately made us feel welcome and talked with us like we were long lost friends. Do yourself a favor and get some smoked meat in your mouth

Long lines if you want to sit and dineThere is a take out section but it's about a 5-10 wait.  Just go up to one of the guys and let them know.  There's also another store that will sell take out and meat by the poundCash onlyOrdered a smoked meat sandwich and then paid at the cashier behind the counter.  As of September 2018, it was 9.95 CAD and with taxes about 11ish.  The sandwich, first impression, was smallBUT it was STACKED with MEAT....small in size, tall in height.  Of course I had to take a bite while it was hot and yes, it was juicy, tender and soft.  Thinner slices than Katz and I think it's more juicier. Definitely messy to eat so get napkins and I wish I had more mustard to help balance the fattinessDefinitely worth trying but not worth waiting in that line when you can take out

Arrived in Montreal this evening and took my daughter to Schwartz's for my first time in 30 years. Went to the takeout. It was empty so it was super fast. Not a single smile or welcome from anyone working there. That's fine though, it's about the sandwich. Sadly, it's not the Schwartz's of my youth. The meat was more crusty than tender but worst of all, it was completely bland.  Terrible disappointment and then my daughter asked me what was the big deal.  I'll give them one more try later before I leave town.

I don't really understand the hype. The restaurant itself is pretty dingy/crowded & the food was bland. I came on a rainy Sunday at 4:30PM so there was no line, but it quickly started filling up & people had to share tables. To their credit, the service at Schwartz's was very friendly and accommodating, but IMO food is much more important than service. I tried the smoked meat as part of a large plate, which comes with bread. You can choose to add on other things, such as pickles, fries, extra bread. The price is a little expensive, but understandable given that it's such a tourist attraction. To be honest I felt like the meat was super bland. I was expecting something much more flavorful & smokey but it just tasted like soft goops of nothing. I had to slather it in a LOT of mustard and pepper for it to taste like anything. Also, the bread they gave was .....not good. It was somehow dry and crumbly yet tasteless and just overall disappointing. I'd say go just to say you went, but don't expect anything amazing.

Felt more like New York than Montreal with the hustle and bustle inside this tight Jewish deli. Had to go to try the smoked meat sandwich. Only waited about 25 minutes outside.  Downside was sharing a table for four with two strangers, but I suppose part of the experience.  The sandwich was simple, and the meat was the star. Dill pickle, hot peppers, and a tangy cole slaw for sides. Almost wish I'd gone twice!

It's not just about the sandwich but the experience is iconic! But today I digress,The worst smoked meat sandwich I have had here in 54 years. It was so fatty and had no flavour. I don't know if the pandemic has affected the business but it has affected the flavour!

The smoked meat sandwich we had was amazing! It was smoked for 8 hours! The coleslaw is also a must, which is prepared in a non traditional way. They use vinegar and the sourness complements the meat so well! The amount of meat for a small plate equals 1.5 sandwiches and a larger plate equals 2.5 sandwiches.

Waited for half an hour for a sandwich. It looked smaller than expected and the person ordering with me had the same impression as well. The meat was juicy and tender but I felt that the taste could be more flavorful. Due to the long wait and having set a high bar for this sandwich, I must say that this experience is a 3 star.

Can't go to MTL without going to Schwartz!! Only got take-out but even by the time I got back to the hotel the sandwiches were still amazing as always. The only service I got was the guy who took my order and the cashier. I ordered all my sandwiches extra fatty and the guy who took my order made sure of that, he even said after these fatties you're going to want them lean next time. Man was he right LOL. The cashier was less interested in cracking jokes and making small talk, just doing her job just trying to get to the end of the line vibe, very blunt and straightforward with everything. Can't blame someone for (ONLY) doing what they're hired to do though. Surprising for Saturday afternoon the take out line exceeded the dine in line(3PMishhh), which I wished i dined in instead but when you got a bunch of hungover homies waiting for you, kinda a no brainier (if you're a decent friend) to get the food to them as soon as possible. No pickle included for take out sandwiches -rolls eyes- Living in Toronto, smoked meat is a rare commodity but is still pretty decent ... until you visit Montreal and realize that Schwartz will always be the best! I mean come on they had a musical and Celine Dion('s husband) purchased partial ownership just so they never change the original recipe, if that doesn't say something than...Will repeat every single time I visit Montreal! I
I dont understand why people love it tbh.The Meat is dry. But i think people love big portions.

Complete trash a$$ establishment. Happy to sell us food in an EMPTY restaurant but forced us out into the POURING rain since apparently food section was close (pointed out after the fact). Food ended up exploding out of the bag as we tried to hustle home. The hilarity and  disingenuous icing on the cake came from the counter attendant that tried to default a tip into my card charge. Clowns.
I've been to a ton of Jewish delis in my life and am not a huge fan of corned beef but the smoked meat sandwich was SO GOOD

We had roast meat sandwiches to go. It was our first time in Montreal and recommended by many to stop by Schwartz's for a sandwich. Omg. We're so glad we did! They were so good!! We didn't want to wait in the long line outside the shop so walked over to the nearby park and ate at a picnic table instead. I'd encourage folks to buy a pickle or coleslaw with the sandwiches to cut the fat BUT It's so worth it! Absolutely Delicious. I want another one now!

The line may be discouraging, but don't worry, it's faster than Disney. We waited about 20-25 minutes for a group of four to be seated around 1pm on a Friday. The inside is very cramped but patrons font seem to mind. They have the menu for both English and French speakers. I got the salami sandwich and also tried my friends smoked meat. Get the smoked meat (comes with mustard).

I'm going to be honest. Schwartz is just ok. Yes I said it and I'll admit, it's not all that. First off, don't even bother standing in line with the rest of them; head straight to the "To-go" shop. They even have some bar stool seats!Their customer service is poor and they don't make you entertained or want you to be there. They guys have attitude and seem unhappy or bothered. One sandwich is good for one person because they pack it with lots of corned beef. I personally thought the meat was dry and stuff. The bread is boring as well as the simple mustard. The corned beef was just plain tasting. You definitely need either vinegar or ketchup to spice things up and add more flavor which is not a good sign. I'll leave it at this... don't believe the hype!!

We skipped the dine in section and opted for the much shorter take out line.  The dine in like looked to be about an hour...we got take out in about 10 minutes.The guys behind the counter were extremely helpful and made a few jokes which made the wait feel just fine.  The smoked beef is the way to go!  The beef is tender and amazing.  Comes on rye bread with some mustard and a pickle.Highly recommended if you're in the area!

I really wanted to like Schwartz's because of all the recommendations I got from friends and from what I read online. I made it a point to come here the first night I arrived. We got seated at the bar right away. The service was good. They were very talkative and engaged in conversation throughout the entire time we were there. I felt like it was a bit misleading though. We knew we each wanted a sandwich but he was also giving us other recommendations that everyone orders. He made it seem like a combo. We each ended up with our sandwich, a cherry cola, a pickle and two poutines to share between four people. Funny thing - neither of us actually like cherry cola or eat pickles but he kept saying it was "not like what you get anywhere else" and again, made it seem like a part of the combo so we agreed. I was a little upset because when our bill came, it was $100 for the four of us. A bit pricey in my opinion for food that didn't taste that great. There was nothing special about the poutine and we didn't finish it between the two of us. Can't say anything about the pickles since I don't actually eat pickles. The sandwich was dry so I had to keep adding mustard. At least it wasn't too salty!

Very yummy sandwich! The service was quick and the waiter was entertaining! It was hard finding parking but glad we didn't turn away as this place was great! Reason for the 4 star is for the price, it was 10.45 for the sandwich which I think is a little steep.
I have died and gone to heaven. Jewish Soul Food Heaven. Menu is simple but oh so good. Just go!!! Sit at the counter if it's one or two.

Wow ive had people bring home the schwartz before and it does not do any justice. I had no expectation here since the ones ive tried in the past were a disappointment. But wow i was amazed when i came to the actual store to try it fresh. Mind blown! So lucky there was no lineup that day. It was so delicious, tender, flavourful & even service was good! Definitely check this spot out for the real deal!

Schwartz's Smoked Meat...savory, juicy, tender, meaty, supple, moist, luscious, smokey, delectable, heavenly, and complete utter perfection.  Forget about Tinder...Schwartz's Smoked Meat is a great substitute for love and sex.  Almost...All the stories, travel shows, tour books, articles...Schwartz's lives up to the hype!!! There might be a line...but if you're alone, or just with your    date, the line moves pretty fast.  We had 20 some people in front of us, but we got seated at the bar in less than 20 minutes. Despite the crazy demand, the friendly staff are chill and keep their cool, and don't rush you while you're enjoying that marvelous, magnificent, and magical smoked  meat...And its all so affordable! And 20% off in American dollars!$9.75 Smoked Meat Sandwich...the closest thing to love, romance, and marriage for less than $10. So FUCing good...$3.40 french fries...a perfect and simple side to the meaty madness.$3.25 cole slaw...I felt like I needed some veggies. Average, but this will help combat your constipation later in the evening. $1.95 Frankfurter...its a basic frankfurter, good, but just go for Smoked Meat.  Its kinda of like that accidental one night stand...you could do better by sticking with love, AKA the Schwartz's smoked meat!Its been months...I still have meat dreams of Schwart's Smoked Meat...

I usually like to write lengthy reviews and give all of the details but I will leave this one short and sweet. COME HERE! GET THE SMOKED MEAT SANDWICH!! THE RUMORS ARE TRUE - IT IS PHENOMENAL!! Do not listen to the haters who say it's all hype. I live in New York City and know a smoked meat sandwich and all I can say is WOW. The line is worth it.
Amazing food! I have to stop by for the beef sandwich and fries every time I am in Montréal. Love this place!

Atmosphere: Cool place. Sort of a dirty diner type feel that always has traffic. We saw all walks of life going to this place so it was relatively diverse. The staff was also a good reflection of that. Food: AWESOME!!!! Got the smoked meat plate, cole slaw, pickles and fries. Again, AWESOME. My wife usually hates smoked flavor but did like the food here. I thought it was great! Service: Great service, we sat at the bar and were attended to immediately. As soon as we were done, the bill was ready. Great service Overall: You have to go here. It is a staple spot in Montreal that you have to experience.

I tried this place all the way back in March of 2017 and just completely forgot to make a review of this place. The smoked meat here is very good, best in Montreal in my opinion. The service is very exceptional and fast at this place. A must try for people visiting Montreal.

One of the greatest eateries on the planet. This simple deli will not disappoint with their classic smoked meat sandwich. Also, if you're a fan of pickles, get one on the side. The meal won't be cheap, but money aside one of tastiest sandwiches you'll eat. Quick tip: turn left to enter through the take out side to get your food quicker and sit on a stool at the bar or eat outside. If you want a table to sit down, you're going to be waiting in line.

First time visitor to Montreal and had to try the Famous Schwartz Deli. I don't normally like Pastrami but had to try the classic. It was good! Not too briney (what I don't like anout pastrami) and it was really good with the yellow mustard. A bit fatty but not so much I couldn't work around it. The fries were amazing! The best I have had in Montreal yet! Also I was able to beat the rush (between 12-1p on a Friday) and didn't have to wait.

U might be very shocked when u see such a low rating on Schwartz's, it's my first time here and it will be the last. Without the service, I would give this place 4 stars, and the 4 stars r for the smoked meat, it is indeed juicy and tender, but all those hype on the yelp reviews, I think people really have to understand what out of this world food tastes like cuz this is not. I definitely don't think it's a must try, in fact I totally forgot about how it tastes like 2 minutes after I walked out of there. Why 2 stars, the service is a mess. First of all, the line was super long but we got two very old people in my family, in the beginning I just went to the takeout line to get the sandwiches but then once I got out, the line was extremely short so we decided to eat in, we still lined up for a while in the heat and once we sat down, my mom took the take out we just bought, and I am looking at menu to order something else, but then i overheard one waiter whispering to another waiter "what the hell are they doing?" and keeps looking at my mom. My family doesn't speak English well so I feel lucky they didn't hear and couldn't really understand how rude those waiters were, but I could so I went up to explain to him and he did not seem happy. Well, we didn't pay less to get the same smoked meat sandwich so why don't you provide us with some plates, instead you bitch about customers behind their back. This is just insanely unprofessional and I hope Schwartz's can put more attention into screening their employees, good food makes people remember you, but rude service can ruin you too.One more note on the rest of the food items on their wall of menus, no matter what we decided to order, one of the waiters just kept telling us, "oh, the chicken is super dry, r u sure? oh the turkey would be cold tho, its not good. no, our fries are okay but i wouldn't recommend...well, people come here for smoked meat, what do you expect", WAIT A MINUTE, if you only have one thing thats good on your menu, THEN YOU PROB SHOULD SHRINK YOUR LONG MENU ON THE WALL SO PEOPLE CAN STOP WASTING TIME DECIDING WHAT TO EAT AND THE LINE CAN MOVE FASTER.
Very popular smoke beef sandwich place. the Price is good more like market food. smoke beef And poutine are good.

Apparently the meat sandwich is the bomb here but I personally didn't taste it because I don't eat meat.  There is a line outside if you want to eat at Schwartz or you can go inside and take it to go which went really fast as they are pre-made and most people order the same thing.  This is a must do in Montreal along with poutine and bagels.

100% totally worth the wait. If you come to Montreal, you absolutely have to go to Schwartz and get the smoked meat sandwiches and the poutine!! The sandwiches don't look super enormous but they are STUFFED with a ton of different smoked meats and they are all absolutely delicious!!! I also ordered the poutine which was obviously amazing as well being a Montreal signature. Definitely come to Schwartz and get the smoked meat sandwich and the poutine!

Great smoked meat sandwich! Service was great as well! Only issue was the long line to the restaurant portion, but take-out was a great alternative. Would definitely recommend for any first-time Montreal goer!

I had heard about Schwartz's being the best smoked meat deli from reviews and later from a friend. I decided to get a sandwich to go from here one day. If you're going to eat the sandwich/meat on the day of getting it, they recommend to get the smoked meat warm. If you're going to save it for a couple of days, they recommend to get it cold as deli meat. You can also buy their famous mustards, but aside from the measly amount of mustard they put on the sandwich breads, they don't give you any mustard on the side if you're taking your sandwich to go. The meat was okay. I definitely had better smoked meat sandwiches in other places, where the meat would just dissolve in my mouth. This meat was just harder to swallow. It had a lot of fatty layers and biting a piece made it tougher and less delicious. Unlike some of the other reviews, I thought the sandwich portions were okay considering the price, which wasn't bad for a filling sandwich with a good chunk of meat.

The all-famous Schwartz was not a disappointment at all. After planning the itinerary for a weekend stay in Montreal, this place was mentioned almost everywhere as a place to eat. They have a take-out and a dine-in line but they were both just as equally packed.While we were waiting in line, a old couple in front turned around and sparked a conversation with us. They were super friendly and asked if we've ever been here before & if we're visitors. We had a long talk about what we did during our time in Montreal and they even suggested a couple more things to do. They try to frequent this establishment once a month and had great things to say which made me even more excited to get inside and eat. The line that seemed super long to me was apparently not long at all according to the couple. After about waiting in line for 30-45 minutes, we finally got in and got seated by the front counter. It's a tiny place inside that gave me a old-school diner feel. Some people had to be paired to share a table and be paired up with strangers in order to be seated. I ordered a smoked meat sandwich and it came out extremely quickly, I'm assuming all the meat is cooked and ready to serve and all they have to do is just put it on the bread. The meat was very flavorful and juicy with just the right amount of fat to it. It was also stacked very high that I had to eat some without the bread because it was too much. The meat felt like it was going to melt in my mouth which was absolutely incredible. I was out and about within 20-25 minutes, I didn't want to keep people waiting outside for too long.I would recommend checking this place out if you have time to spare to wait in line if you visit Montreal..

I've been to Schwartz's many times and most recently this past weekend. I got here around 10:30am on a Saturday and it wasn't that busy yet. The takeout/retail store next door doesn't open until 11am. For takeout you walk up to the counter on the right just through the door and ordered a fatty smoked meat sandwich. You pay at the casher in the corner after the guy hands you your receipt. Fatty meat heaven is all I need to say. Thick, juicy sliced beef brisket piled mile high on rye and covered in mustard. What's not to like?! For me, 5 stars are reserved for an experience that is outstanding overall (eg. combination of service, atmosphere, food) or for a product that is truly outstanding. In the case of Schwartz's and their Smoked Meat this definitely fits the bill! A must try!

I'm usually not one for smoked meats (sometimes it just tastes like beef jerky lol) but Schwartz's was different. At first I ate some random pieces that came out of the sandwich and I was like ehh but then I ate everything together and it opened my eyes to Schwartz and all its splendor. Honestly shared with a friend and I regret it lol. The guy who helped us was like "you'll be back" and he was damn right. I recommend getting the fattier meat as it just melts in your mouth. When I come back to Montreal, I will def hit this place up again!

OK, has anyone in Montreal not been to Schwartz's? You have to go just to say you've been there. The smoked meat sandwich (medium fatty) is the only way to go. If you don't specify medium you are likely going to get a drier sandwich and drier is not better in this case. Not much else to say other than grab a pickle on the side.

I was not impressed at all. At $10.95, the sandwiches are pretty skimpy. Also they are not made to order because it is so busy and the bread is soggy. Perhaps that is why I heard some people ordering the sandwiches with the "bread on the side." The meat was too "meaty" tasting in a bad way, and half of it was just fat. It was pretty gross overall. Please do yourself a favor and skip this place.

Cash only... That should be the headline along with there is an ATM in case you didn't know before you got there.Smoked meat sandwich is just delicious. Order it moist of course and add a bit more mustard. I like that it's reasonably sized and priced unlike the massive sandwiches in NYC delis where you end up with takeaway. Pickle was also nice if you like them sour.Beyond just the food, service and atmosphere is excellent. Reminds me of Washington DC's Ben's Chili Bowl.

Schwartz's is a staple, a Montreal institution when it comes to smoke meat. When asked where I need to definitely visit when I come to Montreal, 3 out of 4 people listed Schwartz's as one of their options. Does it have food that blows your mind? Probably not. That said, it's a perfectly delicious and unpretentious deli. During our visit around 2pm (the lines didn't seem to be out the door by then), my bf and I shared a large plate of smoked meat (you have option of fatty or lean or combo), which came with about 8-10 slices of bread. The meat is dry smoked, yet incredibly tender. And the service was so fast! I think we waited less than 5 minutes to get our order.

Made a brief stop here while in Montreal. While my entourage was purchasing packaged meat to take home, I ordered half a pound of the smoked meat to sample. O. M. G !!! It was so good I'm  finding it hard to find the appropriate words. One of the most mouth watering, flavour filled pieces of meat I've ever had. My only regret I'd not ordering more

A must try whenever you are in Montreal as this is an iconic deli. The service is great with friendly staff who can help out if you are confused about what to order. We went around 5 on a Monday and it was busy but no crazy lines. But we tried going on a weekend morning and the lines were long even outside the place. The food so good and the meat are juicy and tender! The prices are also reasonable. Overall it lives up to the hype.

Don't get me wrong. I absolutely love your meat sandwiches. And I keep coming back for these. During COVID however, measures have been pretty laxed. The server reused an old rag and didn't bother sanitizing using the spray - both tables and chairs. The server came up with his mask down all the way to his cheek. As someone from Toronto, we have strict guidelines as a server. Mandatory masks period. There were droplets coming out of his mouth. He then goes on to take other tables, with his mask removed, touching cutleries, straws, pop and food. It was purely unhygienic during the pandemic. I just didn't feel safe. No matter how much I love deli meat, I will never risk dining in again. As someone form Toronto, we wear our masks even in public spaces.

In Montreal and must try their famous Smoked meat sandwich! It's $9.75 and worth every penny.  The meat is so tender and some parts are fatty but most delicious. You can taste the pepper in it. The bread is nice & soft. The mustard complements it really well.  Come here hungry because it's a lot of meat. Coming from NY, the like this more than Katz deli. Btw, Cash only and walking distance from bus #55 stop.

First time in Montreal, so of course I had to try Schwartz's. And when you visit, you must try their classic roast meat sandwich. There is usually a line, so I've heard, so be prepared to wait. Oh, and bring cash.Verdict - Not gonna lie, it's one of the best roast meat sandwiches I've had. The meat was juicy and fall apart delicious, they gave of ton of it too. Service was good and we got our food quite quickly. I can see why other people rave about this place, it's just not usually my type of food. Also, the bread is plain and eating the sandwich gets messy real fast. We got lucky when we went because but I don't know if I'd wait more than 30 minutes in line for it (though I understood once I was inside - as the inside is very cramped).

The smoked beef sandwich looks amazing in photos, and I was so excited to try their iconic sandwich. Needless to say I was a little disappointed that it was not amazing or mind blowing..... it was just okay.

Oh my goodness! I can tell you one thing, the meat is melt in your mouth delicious! I had ordered the #4 which is their specialty. If you visit Montreal, you need to stop by this little gem. The inside decor reminds me of a deli shop and I love how there's so much different wall decoration. It's just so neat to see a restaurant like that. Service was great too. Our waiter was friendly. He did make some mistakes but he just joked it off with us and we had a great time. Price for a sandwich was around $10CAD. I thought the price was dent for the portion. Overall, really good meat sandwich.

This was a highly anticipated spot knowing the history of the restaurant.  We showed up to a line of about 10-15 people but the line moved extremely quickly and we were seated after about 10 minutes.  To our surprise their tables seat 6 and they group everyone together so as a pit we were sandwiched in between 2 other pairs.  Not the best start, but we were really there for the food.  We ordered the smoked meat sandwiches (#4) and fries.  The sandwiches were overflowing with meat with some fat on them which made them that much better.  The fries were pretty good but not spectacular.  They have a quick turnover rate, so it's not really the place to chat and relax but it has a ton of old pictures and articles which speak to the history.  Overall, it's a must visit.

This place is way overhyped for sure. My friends and I came here to try a sandwich, and we of course got the smoked meat sandwich. The meat was tasty but the sandwich was super tiny, and for 12 CAD, it's definitely not worth it. I also have no idea why people would wait in line for this; we went to the take out shop to get it, and thankfully we did. I wouldn't have been super happy if we waited a long time for this. Definitely can skip it!

Everyone told me the same thing: you can't go to Montreal and not try the smoked meat. In comes Schwartz's, possibly the most popular smoked meat destination of them all.The line to sit down was long, so we headed into the take-out side and got served and seated in there immediately. I went with a smoked meat sandwich and a side of fries. The sandwich was tender and flavorful, with nice pepper notes and a slight smoke. The fries were tasty, nothing overly special, but they fit the bill as a perfect side. Top notch.

There isn't much to say that hasn't already been said. The seating is classic diner (don't expect to have a p.c. there). And the staff is both boisterous, kind, and direct.  If you order the turkey, expect to be judged.  But it will still be a damn good turkey.   Don't skimp on the rye bread and side of pickles.  They are mind blowing.  Also, if you do manage to get there before the line up hits, consider yourself a lucky person!  The line is often long but well worth the wait.

Wow 90 years. It is rare to have a restaurant with this long history.Every time we go to Schartz's, I have a smoked meat sandwich and my hubby has a small plate. We can choose lean, medium and fat. I always go with medium. He may have half medium and half fat. Pickle and coleslaw, and definitely the famous cherry drink.This time we also ordered a smoked duck and picked up after 3 days. I like the duck also. We usually go there on weekdays to avoid the queue.

I often recommend Schwartz's when people ask me for things to do in Montreal. Smoked meat is a must in Montreal and Schwartz's does a terrific job in fulfilling this experience. I highly recommend just getting take-out rather than dining in. It's way faster and to begin with, there isn't really much room. You can ordered the smoked meats by pound or by sandwich. The sandwich is about $10 while the smoked meat by pound is about ~$20. I recommend just ordering by pound if you're eating with a group. If you're only trying for yourself, grab a sandwich. Sliced smoked meat and brisket are pretty much the same thing. Buy a loaf of bread while you're at it. Slab on some mustard on the bread and assemble your sandwich; it'll be one of your favorite meals in Montreal. You can also get individually wrapped pickles for your sandwich as well :3The smoked meat poutine is also reallllly good! I highly recommend this if you want a little more to your meal. When you order take out, you can actually bring your food to the back to eat. If there isn't room, just walk down St Laurent Boulevard and you'll find seating somewhere. You're also somewhat close to Mt Royal so you can always take it there to eat.

user_city: Monmouth Junction, South Brunswick Township, NJ
user_review: The decor is wonderfully reminiscent of any of the delis I have been to in NY.  However, the menu is extremely limited.  I had salami and my daughter had smoked meat.  The salami was as I would expect.  The smoked meat was VERY fatty.  The waiter was going on and on about how different it was from any other smoked meat I had eaten.  Not particularly!  It tasted basically like any other meat I have had.  Not horrible, but certainly not amazing!  I definitely would not go out of my way to visit this restaurant again when visiting Montreal.  I have had far better meat, at a much lower price.  And I see no point in going to a deli where my choices are so limited.  Also, the parking situation near the deli is impossible.

After dining here, my personal feeling is that this place benefited greatly from celebrity word of mouth and its reputation over the years as a smoked meat mecca.But is it a culinary revelation that puts famous Jewish deli stalwarts like Katz's in NYC to shame?  Absolutely not.I made a point of dining in the restaurant and got here at 10:30am on a weekday to ensure I don't get engulfed by the long lines.  Fortunately the restaurant was barely half full when I got in.  I sat down and made sure I had the full experience in hand.  I ordered their famous smoked meat sandwich and paired it with a plate of poutine and cole slaw.The sandwich was fine.  To be honest, their meat felt a little dry, even thought it was still flavorful and a solid sandwich as a whole.  The poutine was also ok.  It wasn't the best poutine I had in Montreal by a stretch but it was still tasty and a pure artery-clogging experience.  The cole slaw was just average IMO.Generally speaking if it wasn't for all the hype around this place, I would probably have more reasonable expectations.  But even if I strip out all of my preconceived notions, frankly speaking I still think a good smoked meat sandwich from Katz's or even Carnegie Deli (or even Junior's) in NYC is still a cut above simply because their meat is juicier and more flavorful.  But all in all, it's still not a bad place to grab a nice deli sandwich.  I just don't think I'd ever wait an hour in line for this.

After visiting a couple of Montreal delis, I have to say that Schwartz's is the best one and is the quintessential place for a smoked meat sandwich in Montreal.  Yes there is an unfriendly lady managing the pay counter but the sandwiches, the meat quality and speed of service for what you pay are pretty on point.This location is cramped and not very high end but it gets heavy traffic and I know why, they have excellent sandwiches which are more firm and meaty than their competitors.I almost took off a star due to the lady at the pay counter but she's not so bad.  FYI cash only!

***HOW TO SKIP THE LINE *** Wanted to come back before we left the city. We saw a huge line and didn't want to stand in it so we went next door to the to go area. We ordered by the pound (when ordering by the pound it's not taxed) and ordered half a loaf of bread. There was a seating area in the to go section there's just not service. The three of us shared the meat and bread. Ordering it by the pound is more worth your money than ordering sandwiches.

I'm giving this place a five because it is what it is supposed to be. Montreal's legendary smoked meat Mecca. Maybe that is the wrong metaphor since it's run by some Jewish folks, but the idea is right. It's crowded all the time and you have to wait in line outside for the surly wait person to come out and check the line for a party of your size. It looks like they have spent $0 ever for renovation. There is a window in front with a pile of whatever they've recently cooked. Usuallly, a pile of beef briskets, tied in string. Last night it was aPile of smoked chickens very unglamourously dumped. Of course, they don't stay here long, so why make an elegant pile? When you do get inside, you have very few choices to make on the limited menu. It is crowded and noisy and you need to be ready to order as you sit down. This is all, OK! It's part of the Schwartz's shtick. The simple thing to do, then, is immediately order a brisket sandwich and a pickle. I'd also get some fries (frites) which are pretty good. Here is the big hint - get the FATTY brisket in your sandwich. They have three settings: lean (=meat cardboard anywhere including here), medium (what I had mistakenly ordered in the past = just OK), and fatty (= the one that is unmatched and unbeatable). So moist and tender and flavorful. Fatty. Remember that. No beer here. Just water, soft drinks and such. In a way, it's brilliant because with the simple menu and inventory, they can serve you within five minutes even with all he crowd all the time. My chum from work (we are here for a convention) thought it was totally great too.

Hot damn. This is a meat lover's dream come true. What more can you ask for when you already get stacks on stacks on stacks of smoked meat in a hot sandwich. If I had the stomach for it, I would probably eat 5 more. What the heck, just give me a plate of the smoked meat instead and i'll instantly devour it! For about $10 Canadian cash (which is not too shabby), you get a hot smoked meat sandwich layered with lots of smoked meat and mustard in between. So simple yet so orgasmic. Meat is so tender and juicy and it just melts in your mouth with every bite. I probably ate this whole sammie in less than 5 minutes. I had to slow down so I wouldn't choke on the meat...Other than their popular hot smoked meat sandwiches, you can also buy other meat like turkey, chicken, and salami. They also have sides like pickles and fries. Curious in trying the other stuff but I think I'll stick with their smoke meat ;)Schwartz's has a dine in area with a few tables and seats and also a TO-GO area with a few stools here and there. If you want to avoid the long line and wait I suggest you go get yourself a few sammies and plates of meat from the TO-GO area and eat elsewhere :). Quick and efficient service for stacks on stacks of hot smoked meat!

Okay America, meet Montreal-style Smoked Meat. Smoked Meat lovers, it is the ​time to cop a squat and take note because​ I have something from a delicatessen we really don't have at our Jewish and Italian Delis. Enter: "Smoked Meat". Do not be like me and wonder "What kind of Pastrami is this?" because it is not Pastrami. In many ways, Montreal Smoked Meat is a crossbreed​ of Corned Beef and Pastrami. Much like the two American (or, at least, fostered​ "American") styles, Smoked Meat, which is made from Brisket, is first brined before being smoked. One key difference, though, is the flavoring in the seasoning itself. While both Pastrami and Smoked Meat utilize Black Pepper, Coriander, Garlic and Mustard Seed as key seasonings, Smoked Meat uses much less Sugar during the curing process than Pastrami does. But like Pastrami, Smoked Meat is traditionally served in a Sandwich​ on Rye with plenty of Mustard. So it is like... "Corned Pastrami" (???). I have a feeling only Mike P. in HB will get all of this.I digress. On to Schwartz's:Much like Katz's to NYC or Langer's in Los Angeles, Schwartz's is a bonafide Montreal institution - nothing less than one of the most celebrated​ delis in the world. It inspired a documentary film and even a live musical (yes, a musical). The Hebrew-style Delicatessen has been open since 1928 and its walls are entirely​ plastered with articles and photos of honorable​ guests ranging from competitors​ like Hank Aaron, actors such as Jerry Lewis and Burt Lancaster, and French Canada's most beloved hometown hero, Celine Dion (now a business partner per my Uber driver and the bartender at NorthStar).And now the Sandwich:You will ​always start with the OG; The Smoked Meat Sandwich​. The fast-talking​ and no-crap-taking waitperson will ask how you want it and what he/she means is "how much fat content". This goes low/medium/high and they will suggest medium. They are right. They will also suggest downing the Sandwich with their Black Cherry Cola. They are right again.  The rest is on autopilot and all you need to do is add Mustard. Do this. The result is a luscious​, briny meat with a loveable mouthfeel and a calmed​ Rye Bread experience​ compared to what I told you not to compare it to. The portions, however, roughly​ are. A very, very good Sandwich that is not Pastrami. Or a Rueben. Or #19. In closing, there is no denying Schwartz's history and quality of their Sandwiches but damn it, ​people - it is simply not Pastrami.

We were in line for like 20 mins or so. So many people were waiting when we got inside. We ordered No.4, which basically it was a smoke meet sandwich with mustard sauce, and a poutine.Smoke meat was really nice with awesome flavor. Poutine was also great with thick gravy and cheese.  This place is totally worth a try!

Understandable why this is considered an icon within Montréal's food scene. Was recommended to visit here by someone who attended college at Concordia and it was a great suggestion. Loved the homey atmosphere combined with the eagerness to try something everyone raves about. Loved me some tasty corned beef and washed it all down with a cherry soda.

Couple of my friends suggested that I visit the place during my short trip. There was a line up, expected this due to the hype. There's not much seating and I honestly expected this too after what I observed with Montreal's dining scene. I love the diner feel, the dive feel somehow. Luckily, we got seated within 10minutes of the line up, bypassed some people since there was only 2 of us and we were willing to be seated at the counter.The food: WAS AWESOME. Best smoked meat ever! Bf approved and he's a bit hard to please when it comes to food. Love the fat on the meat. Got a cherry coke for the first time and it was just a perfect combination!The service: Everyone was so friendly! Being seated at the counter, we felt like locals. They were really busy but the guy manning the counter managed to talk to us a bit, smiling. You can tell they're proud of what they have going and happy to serve!

Perhaps the best smoked meat sandwiches I have ever had. Although it is a very touristy restaurant and quite well known, it has been my favourite stop. The restaurant feels unchanged since my first time I went years ago, and each time I'm still happy to wait to half an hour or more it takes to get in!There are comparable smoked meat sandwiches in Montreal I've been told, but I still enjoy this one the most compared to the other spots I've tried. Definitely recommend at least trying out Schwartz's at least once and you can make your own judgments.Also a small tip, if you don't mind a smaller area to eat on, get a spot on the counter top so you can watch them carving the smoked meat!

The whole atmosphere of Schwartz is part of coming here... the waiting in line to get in (but u can go next door to their "to go" restaurant if u don't want to wait), the crowded seating arrange inside to the signs and articles about the restaurant and people who have eaten here! We only had about a 15-20 minute wait at 11:15am but when we left around 12:30 it was at least a block long! Service was in English and you could be seated with others (our table had 5 young people, too who ate 3 large platters of smoked meat and at least a loaf and half of rye bread)! We split a hot dog, pickle (it's a Jewish deli) and a smoked meat sandwich! Now sandwich bread is smaller then our sandwich bread but the meat is at least 2-3" tall! Very moist and tasty...especially with the mustard. Worth the wait for the whole experience! Just remember..cash only- no credit cards!

Awesome. Better than I even expected. The smoked meat sandwich was great, but the biggest surprises were the slaw and pickles, which were among the best I've ever had. (The slaw had little or no mayo, which I loved.) Great food, great prices, and a cool experience. Definitely will come back next time I'm in Montreal.
Has too much clout for its own good. Expensive and overrated. My Palestinian friend says he likes it though.
Not good tasting experience as it is too croooooowded smoked meet is a little bit salty

I hate lining up for food, but this was worth the 45 min wait. Simple, no frills diner. CASH ONLY. Smoked meat sandwich - no smoky flavor but the mountain of meat was so soft and warm. Good mix of lean, fat and peppery crust. Top with mustard for more flavor.

Had to try it, mostly to say I did and see if it lived up to the hype. Waited in a long line, but it moved pretty quickly. Yes, the sandwich is delicious. Not something I'd crave all the time but definitely worth a wait once in a while. Walk down the street and eat it outside while viewing some street art if you don't like the crowd.
Food was amazing! Meat was moist!! Fast service as long as you do take out!! For dine in avoid rush hours!!Meat was so good, and good portion!! The seasoning was on point!

This is one of those places you need to try when you visit Montreal. Don't be surprised by the long queue to enter the restaurant, so arrive at least 30 min in advance to make sure you don't starve while waiting. They also have a takeaway option with a short wait next to the main door.I opted for the famous smoked meat sandwich with mustard (#4) and fries as a side dish. The meat was tender and tasty and I understood why this place attracts so many people. It's supposed to have been open for over 90 years. Don't expect any fancy decoration inside, but I guess it's what makes it different from other places. The waiter that served me was also a plus.5/5 recommend.

This smoked meat sandwich goooooood.Sunday lunch hour is insane. Instead of waiting in line for waiter service, we waited in line next door for take out. However, there are seats in the back of the store and if you're okay eating with people waiting behind you, then this is a-ok.Food: Smoked meat sandwich, duh. I actually think I prefer this over pastrami from NY delis, whoops. The meat is so flavorful, moist, and they put the right amount of mustard on the sammy. The bread is super soft and the sandwich as a whole is thoroughly satisfying. This place is a staple, and I can see why. I definitely plan to hit it up again if I ever come back to Montreal (which I hope to!).

GO HERE EVEN IF IT IS OUT OF YOUR WAY. the line is so long and I was a little put off by the smell of meat outside, but the sandwich is so damn good and the service is very fast. It's easier to get in with a smaller group of people and you'll likely have to set next to strangers, but all you'll be focused on is the sandwich. Four of us ordered a medium smoked sandwich and it was juicy and amazing. It comes with mustard and you can't put anything else on it, but you can get a side of coleslaw and fries. Definitely get the coleslaw and share the plate of fries with someone. It's a lot!

The smoked meat sandwich was absolutely amazing. The meat was so warm and tender - it literally melts in your mouth. We had to wait on a line for at least 15 minutes, but it was worth it. This is definitely a must eat in Montreal! We chose the pick-up option (as opposed to sit in), had our sandwich on the-go and it kept us warm in the freezing cold

Good corned beef sandwich nothing more! Place is kind of dirty and rundown- 2.50 for a pickle seemed overpriced. No horseradish which is usually served with a classic corned beef sandwich. No alcohol is served at this place.

So. Very. Crowded.If you're the tiniest bit claustrophobic, don't even think about waiting in line to get into this place. I'm not, so I was perfectly fine. After a20-minute wait for my party of 5, we were ushered to the very back of the restaurant where we were told that Drake sat at the table in front of us once. We were also told that Celine Dion is part owner! Boy, does Montréal love Celine.My group all got smoked meat sandwiches. I got coleslaw as my side and we shared fries and pickles. Well, A pickle. The thing was huge. The smoked meat is everything they say it is. Juicy, smoky, delicious. I put extra mustard on mine as I like the tang of it. The coleslaw was pretty good, too. Thinly sliced cabbage with a light, slightly sweet, vinegary dressing. I recommend it to cut the fat of the meat.It's definitely touristy, and definitely worth it. Go.

There's not much to say that everyone else hasn't said about this place. Assuming you like smoked meat, you will like Schwartz's. It's delicious and getting a plate and splitting it is perfect. I don't think it's overhyped as in it's not that good, but it is maybe over hyped in that there are other restaurants that will provide similarly delicious smoked meat. BUT this one is the OG so you should go. Don't wait too long in line, go to the take out counter if it's not a dinner event. It's quick, it's delicious, it's cheap and the service is great.

The hype is justified.  The medium fat sando is one of the best sandwiches i've ever had - easily in top 3. Another win here is the pickles - its hard to find proper salty pickles in the US luckily this place sells em by the jar; also has pickled tomatoes which is nice old world touch.

The best smoked meat sandwich I have ever had. I didn't want to waste time waiting in line for the sit-down restaurant, so we ended up going to the deli / to-go store right next door. We did end up having to wait a little bit to order, but it wasn't too long. They actually do have some counter seats in the back, so we grabbed a couple chairs and split a sandwich. We weren't too hungry and just wanted to try some of the famous smoked meat sandwich so this was a perfect amount of food. The meat was so juicy and flavorful that it melted right in your mouth. The bread was slightly dry but the amount of fat and juices from the meat balanced it out. Would definitely come back again to order the sandwiches!

This joint is a long-time main stay. Opened in 1928, this is the oldest deli in all of Canada. There was a 30 minute wait for their outside seating, which was nothing special. Metal chairs, long plastic table-clothed tables under a makeshift cheap awning. Inside seating was open already, so we went with the latter. Besides, it was rather hot (in the 80s), so no complaining here. The eatery is a small space. There's old dinner bar stool seating and communal tables down the other side. Chatting with the gal beside me, she's from Paris, but's living in Montreal. She expressed how Montreal is a tourist city, yes, but old restaurants like Schwartz is engrained in the fabric of society. Our waiter informed us you can order medium or lean. This refers to the amount of fat you want on the shaved meat. Our waiter recommended medium, so when in Rome, do as the Romans do.It's on the smaller size, circumference-wise. But packed high with the tender as hell beef. The original simply has plain ol yellow mustard, nothing more. The bread is soft and airy, leaves optimal room for the protein!!The best smoked beef sandwich I've ever chomped on! The taste will forever remain ingrained on my tongue.

This place lives up to the hype. I came here specifically just to try the smoked meat sandwich. Our waiter was super nice and gave his recommendations. I ordered the sandwich with a side of pickle and coleslaw. Completely worth the price they charge for it. The meat was absolutely perfect and I love that it comes with mustard and that's it. This makes you really appreciate the mean itself. I would come back here in a heartbeat and I strongly recommend this sandwich.

Lives up to its name, a must visit in Montreal, usually I find smoked meat too greasy and salty, but Schwartz smoked meat is perfectly seasoned. Addictive taste! It is cash only and in a tight space, so be prepared to sit next to someone you don't know!

This is a must-stop establishment in Montreal and if you plan on sitting to eat without a long wait, get there before noon. Luckily I stayed around the corner, so I went the take out route, which is a separate area. I was in and out in 10 minutes. The fries are really good and the pickles are delicious. The sandwich is small, but loaded with meat. The meat had good flavor and smoke to it, but it was not anything I'd wait in line for an extended period. There is so much good food in the city, don't spend time in line if you don't have to. You can get it to go and sit outside on a bench or if you're lucky, the sit-in wait won't be too bad.

Every time I pass by, there's a long line for dine in, so we only do takeout. Highly recommend the smoked meat but would skip the salami. Many people complain about the bread being too small but I personally appreciate the generous amount of meat you get without the bread stealing the spotlight.

the line up is crazy!! their smoked meat sandwich is quite delicious but a tad too salty for me. a little more mustard would be nice. we picked up 2 slabs of meat to bring back to toronto for some friends. quite pricy but everyone loved it! see you again soon schwartz!!

If you're in Montreal and you're a fan of smoked meats, you should definitely give Schwartz's a try!They have delicious smoked meat which is best when asked for medium fatty! The bread was average - nothing to write home about, and it definitely could be tastier. But it's okay, the meat the star anyway! It's salty, peppery, and just the right amount of fatty (you can always ask for more or less fatty meat). If you want to sit inside, chances are that there is a pretty long line. If you want to skip the line, consider take-out because there is a separate, much shorter line.Cash only!

This is a NO BRAINER. Yeah, the line sucks poutine gravy and it just may be considered a touristy spot. When you're standing in front of the joint, you'll find yourself asking if it's worth the wait. Don't be discouraged though, the line is most likely for the sit down side of Schwartz's. That's how we felt until we found the line to the take out/away which was much shorter and quite fast. The menu is simplified to the max. Three types of sandwiches, poutines, and pickles. All you need is their infamous smoked meat sandwich (first one on the sign, about $10 CAD). The other two sandwiches I can recall is turkey and pastrami. The line probably took us about 10-15 minutes and we got the food the second we placed the order. It's not prepackaged, they just have guys continuously pumping them out. That's why the menu for the take out side of the house is very minimal. We grabbed a few of their #1 smoked meat sandwiches and headed across the street to hang out like hoodlums and enjoy the feast. Trust me, we weren't the only ones doing this. The smoked meat is super tender and not too salty. I wished they had grey poupon available! The sandwich comes with a little mustard but I would suggest adding a little more to spruce up all that meat that is going into your mouth. That's all the sandwich really is; soft white bread, tons of meat, and a dab of mustard. Sounds boring, right? But really it's not. Initially it's like meh but then it leaves you with a lasting impression that comes out of nowhere. We even had this after a full blown meal nearby. I will say, one order for a single person will definitely put you in a coma.If ever in Montreal, don't pass this up especially if you're not a local like myself. It's an one time deal until you come back on another trip. They've been in business since about 1928; it's practically an iconic landmark. The dine in line sucks but just opt for the take out line and eat it elsewhere. You'll be on your way to the next eating adventure in under 30 minutes. Cash only, be ready to sling that CAD$.

It's pretty simple: If you visit Montreal, you go to Shwartz's and get a smoked meat sandwich. The sandwich itself is also very simple: A good sized portion of meat between two slices of light rye bread slathered in mustard. That's really all you need, though the sides are pretty good as well. Is it touristy? Yes, but there's a good reason for that. Schwartz's has been there for 90 years and they make a damn good smoked meat sandwich. That being said, I wouldn't wait in line all day for it. If you get to Schwartz's close enough to opening, you won't have to wait. For those of you short on time, The Main is right across the street and makes a decent smoked meat sandwich with no waiting anytime.

Came here on my trip to Montreal cause everyone raved about how amazing the smoked meat was at Schwartz. The restaurant isnt very fancy but thats not what I came for. My friend and I were seated fairly quickly and had menus given to us. We both chose the large smoked meat platter which was very delicious. The platter was perfect for 2 people and the meat was perfectly cooked with a lot of flavor. I would honestly give the smoked meat a 5/5 but I had to take a few stars away due to the poor service. Our server was abrupt and unhelpful when we asked for recommendations and spoke condescendingly towards us. At first we thought it wasn't a big deal but then an asian couple came in with their child. The child was basically just moving around in the seat and the server began to scold the family and the child, which kinda forced the mom to leave with the child. That left a sour taste and kinda ruined the experience. If i returned I feel like I'd be okay getting the food to go.

There's a lot of hype about this place so I decided to try it during a lunch break. I got a sandwhich and although I really enjoyed it, it's tough to justify the hype and cost. I also had the coleslaw and it was alright. I would bring a friend here if they were visiting the city but probably wouldn't go out of my way to get it on my own. Worth a try if it's your first time though.

What Katz's Deli is to NYC, Schwartz's is to Montreal.Around since time immemorial (ok, 1928), this deli may not have invented smoked meat...but you won't find it better anywhere else. Got there around 8pm on a Friday night to a line leading out the door. Fortunately, turnover for the few tables and counter stools is VERY quick. My friend and I were seated at a table with a young family. I knew my order as soon as I sat down: smoked meat (medium fat), sour pickle, black cherry soda. My friend snagged the same with fries instead of a pickle.The meat was tender, gently smoky, and maddeningly delicious. The seasonings are assertive without overwhelming and the sour pickle provides a biting contrast.In and out in less than half an hour. And, yes: that sandwich was worth the 8 hours or so it took to get to Montreal

Ok, so on my list of places to go eat at in Montreal is Schwartz's! And my list is growing based on new recommendations, at any rate, let me get back to the business at hand. The Amazzzzing smoked meat sandwich!I ventured through the streets of Old Montreal and Villa Marie then made it to this restaurant. There was a line up out front, not surprised, waited 15 minutes and I was in.Walking in, you are transported to the mid 80's style diner. Everything there was decades old, which adds character & authenticity. I grabbed a bar seat, and was greeted promptly. The menu was on the wall, nice & simple. I asked what's the most popular and was advised the 1/2 LB or 1 LB smoked Beef sandwich. I ordered 1/2 LB so I can walk out vs ambulance  assist and added a pickle as well. The sandwich arrived and I could smell the meat, it was wrapped in 3 slices of bread, and a splash of mustard as well. This meat has been ages 45 days and they have been doing this since 1929 I believe. It was delicious and I may go back before I leave. Thumbs up! A true Montreal icon, highly recommend it!

I get It. I understand why people hype this place up so much. Be prepare to wait in line if you want a table and to be served. Next door, there is a togo line and It is MUCH faster. Just go with the "hot meat" which is corned beef. Fries are pretty good but oily af. You can expect the meat to be medium fat and a little oily like pillows of heaven. The sandwiches are small but have a ton of meat! Also prices are extremely reasonable, about $7 for a sandwich. Went with a group of 12 people and we paid $190 for 12 sandwiches and drinks plus a few fries.... Schwartz's for the win

We got a seat at the bar right away. The staff was friendly and the food was FAST! We ordered a medium-fat, 1 plate of fries and a cherry coke, as recommended by our local friend. We were not disappointed. Even as a woman, I was able to eat my whole sandwich, but I had to take about 1/2 the meat off. Lucky for me, my husband eats anything I don't so nothing goes to waste.This was phenomenal and we will be back!

It lives up to the hype. There's a sitdown restaurant with a pretty long line and pretty glorious smells emanating from the doors. Next door there is a takeout place. Given my level of patience and that my car was definitely illegally parked, I opted for takeout. I just got the smoked meat sandwich. First time having smoked montreal meat! I honestly can't tell the difference between this and pastrami. The sandwich is taller than it is wide , stuffed with meat , with mustard on Rye. I enjoyed the meat alone better than the sandwich itself. Either way, five stars, worth $11, I would go back!!

2 summers ago, it was a St Laurent street sale in August. My friend and I were bar hopping, enjoying various terraces in the neighbourhood when we decided to have dinner.As we entered we were greeted with "Are you from here?", that's a bizarre way to greet someone (but then it made sense....keep reading)We said we're proper Montrealers, got seated and gave our orders, one medium and one fatty. Our plates arrived, i took a look at my "medium", it was dry and lean. I took a look at my friends and it was lean too. A group of French tourists, brought there by their daughter, sat beside us. We struck a conversation, and saw even they got a lean.After we paid up, I confirmed with my friend that his sandwich was lean too. Since that day, i shall and never will step foot in a Schwartz. Let the tourist be their main cash cow, chui Montrealais, I know where to get a good smoked meat in this town.....or off this island ;)

They aren't still lining up down the block here for nothing. The smoked meat sandwich here is still the delicious reason to show up, even if it seems to have gotten a bit smaller over time.If you plan to eat here (and haven't before), arrive early or come at an odd time like mid-afternoon when you can be seated. Even if you come at a crowded time, things move quickly. You will share a table with strangers regardless.Note that they have a take out store two doors down that has some seating in the back. They start serving sandwiches at 11. If you just want the sandwich, or if you want to pick up some to go, this is a great option. They have packaged meat, as well as mustards, seasoning, slaw, etc.
