Must have when in Montreal. You go there for experience as well as for amazing meat. Be ready to stand in line and don't forget get cherry soda and pickles with your sandwich

I came here with my family for lunch on a Monday in  June. It was raining and luckily found parking on the street. We got there and didn't see a line at 11am. The staff speak english and French.  We ordered the famous pastrami on rye bread and didn't wait too long. The pastrami was tendered on the rye bread. The fries was freshly cooked and tasty too. The cashier lady was nice and friendly and she urges everyone tip the staff which I don't mind. She mentioned that Celine was the owner of this place. By 11:30am, the place was so crowded and people was waiting inside and outside. I highly recommend this place. Ryan Gosling came here too.

I have heard so much about this place so I had to try while I was in Montreal. I was prepared to wait long but actually there was no wait and I got seated immediately. I ordered smoked meat sandwich and it came out almost immediately also. It's so big so one order should be enough for two people, if you  guys are not too hungry. For the taste, maybe my expectation was too high and it was nothing like WOW but it was pretty good. They only accept cash so make sure to get some Canadian dollar as they charge more for US dollar.

smoke meat sandwich from a smoke meat specialty shop that has been serving the community for 100 years.  we ordered the classic smoke beef sandwich and a poutine.  the smoke beef is super delicious- it's not too fatty nor too lean, but juicy and tender.  and unlike those sold in supermarkets, it's not too salty.  really a must-try in Montreal.  it is old school, very busy small shop so be prepared to share table.  it does have lineup even in winter for the sit-it location so make sure to bundle up.

My view on smoked meat has forever changed thanks to Schwartz. I bought the cold cut brisket to bring home to Toronto and it is oh so good!! This afternoon for lunch, I've combined the meat with some St. Viateur bagels and honey mustard and the combo just hit me hard and reminded me of just how much Montreal cares about their food. Seriously - Schwartz is a must stop for those who love their meat!

I've had much better briskets in many different places. we were waiting in a line forever to get a mediocre brisket sandwich. the mustard was cheap old French mustard. I didn't like the coleslaw at all. I tried their Frankforter, and it was no good. even store brands are better than what I got.The pick was good though.Our waiter was very nice and funny and made the whole experience very fun.they only accept cash, so don't forget to bring enough cash with you.if you want to get a taste of the famous Schwartz in Montreal, at least go for take-out and don't stay in the long line.It's one of those touristy restaurants that come up in any search in Montreal, you may want to go there to make sure you've visited Montreal.

We stopped in for a late night snack, and the three of us shared a sandwich. It was empty, so we were served quickly, and we stood inside while we devoured the deliciously fatty sandwich. The meat was moist and fatty, and I would highly recommend it, even over New York style pastrami.

With so many great reviews, we waited in line for their renowned smoked meat!!Maybe it's just our luck, our orders of smoked meat came out to be too dry.. what happened to "juicy"?? Btw, cash only, no credit card.

That smoked meat. Wow. I may plan another trip to Montreal just to eat here a few times. Seriously.I would fly in before lunch and grab a sandwich straight away. Then maybe somewhere else for dinner.Then back here the next evening for dinner. Like only once a day...I'm not saying I would go overboard or anything. If you have not been here and you are a carnivore or omnivore...you must. Vegans and vegetarians...I am sure there is somewhere else you can go around here.

What a great place to come for smoked meat when in Montreal! Be prepared to wait in line and sit in cramped areas. But the food and atmosphere is definitely worth it. The workers there are just fabulous and hilarious. If you are able to, take some smoked meat home. The meat was so tender and delicious.  There isn't really anything special about their fries but you need some type of filler.

Food: 5/5Service: 4/5Cleanliness: 2/5Decor & Style: 1/55 star overall because it is the second best smoked meat (and even corned beef) I have ever tasted in my life! My favorite smoked beef place actually happens to be in Montreal as well (See Pub Bishop & Bagg yelp.com/biz/pub-bishop-…).Amazing tasting meat on what I consider plain rye bread (nothing special). The mustard is good. Wait is long, overly crowded for 10pm, not clean, and a serious "hole". Worth trying once if you're visiting for sure though.

If you are savoring the taste of the NY deli scene, then Schwartz's is your elixir. The ambiance, the tourists, and the corned beef (Viande Fumée) on rye w/pickle should remind you of Katz's on the lower east side for a minute. If smoked meat is big in Montreal, then Schwartz's sets the standard. Get a can of Cott's black cherry soda with its 50+ grams of sugar to wash it all down.

Pretty good, but not mind blowing.   Maybe I'm just not a Montreal smoked meat guy, but if this is the pinnacle, I'm not impressed.Menu is pretty limited.   Their signature pastrami sandwich and a few other items.   Fries are really solid. Taste fresh cut.Kudos for the fair prices

Overrated! A tourist trap. Yes the meat is good but it's not great, and definitely not worth the wait/cash only greed/rushed rude service. Plenty of other smoked beef places around Montreal that aren't slimy rip offs. PS, they give the option of paying US dollars to rip you off even more. They claim they are doing 10% surcharge for the exchange  but it's actually closer to 25% so don't fall for their second tourist trap inside their bigger tourist trap.

Bottom line, it was a yummy sandwich but soured by subpar service. As recommended by a billion blogs and travel sites, we got a smoked meat sandwich. Since there was a massive line snaking out from the sit-in restaurant, we decided to grab the sandwich to-go from their deli next door instead, where the line was only about 10 people long.The smoked meat was definitely melt-in-your mouth, juicy and full of flavor, but the indifferent service left a bad taste in our mouths. It was dinner time, and the guys behind the counter were evidently "over" the steady stream of tourists, and the lady ringing us up at the cash register acted like she was doing us a favor. Jeez, sorry I'm wasting your time??Dang, it genuinely bummed me out that I didn't enjoy Schwartz's. I can say I've tried it once, but I doubt I'll be back again in the future.

As tourist, this is one of the things in my to do list while I was staying at Montreal. Well, waiting at long line in a windy wet day was not fun at all. The place is small, tables are small too, we shared table with strangers. The smocked meat tasted good, but not surprisingly good, considering waiting for long time which makes you raise expectations.

Another MUST try from everyone who I mentioned I was going to Montreal to.  Personally, I'm not quite sure I understand the hype, and didn't find the food that amazing (combined with some abrasive service) but the 25+ people waiting outside to get in when I left definitely shows I'm in the minority.  Menu is above on the wall and it's really spelled out for first timers like me, so I ended up just getting what it seemed everyone else came for - The Smoked Meat Sandwich.  Again, not quite my taste, but the pickle I added was good lol.  No clue what the Combo plates are all about since I was slightly yelled at when I asked.... Also still wondering what a side of Nash is lol. CASH ONLY so be prepared.

Everyone kept telling us to come here for the sandwiches so we had to try it. We sat outside with our dog. Th service was fast and the staff was knowledgeable. It was really good! I'm not a big fan of this type of food usually so it was nice to try it. Overall the meat was very juicy and flavorful. I would suggest it to other friends to try if they ever visit the area.
Incredibly bomb sandwich!   Coleslaw is the best I've even had.   Very great crunch and vinegar punch.Not much more to say than that!

Yes the smoked meat is good, actually it's great...Definitely an interesting combination of 'real' MTL and equally (probably even more..) a highly touristy experience.The line are ridiculous.  I would only go at 'off' times or squeeze around for take out counter. The staff is entertaining, sometimes grumpy, sometimes funny...Remember this city has other great smoked meat spots.... Without the lines.  Montreal does not lack culinary experiences.  Unfortunately CASH ONLY (it's 2017!??!?!).

Went around 7:30 and had no problem getting table, walked by earlier line was crazy long. Took the suggestion from yelper to get beef platter, which was a great call. Three people could share this, came with bread. We ordered side of fries..very moist , get it done medium! Only downside if your from US must have cash or Canada issued credit card, they do have an ATM in restaurant.

I had a salad. No, I'm kidding. I had the smoked meat sandwich and it was awesome.The place isn't big on the finishes. It's all about the food here and the service isn't fantastic. It doesn't have to be because the smoked meat is the bomb. My waiter understood my English ("smoked meat sandwich, please") and it didn't take long before a half pound of tasty beef on sliced rye was placed in front of me. I ate half with fork before I dared to pick up the monster. When I was done, the plate was clean. I nearly picked it up and licked it.Not cheap but it's not expensive. Very high quality comes at a decent price. It's worth it.

I'm so glad I heeded a fellow foodies advice in checking out Schwartz's which is a long time pillar of Montreal, serving up massive but delicious smoked meat sandwiches in a very casual but busy diner setting. My boyfriend and I were truly lucky (since there is usually a line that wraps along the block) to be seated a small table immediately. We ordered a sandwich each for ourselves, a pickle, two meat sticks, and the poutine. I gave a four since everything else lacked except the sandwich! So if you do decide to come maybe just get the sandwich or meats platter and pickle to share! IG: @KFitzEats

We have been to Katz deli in NYC and this place is in that same league with outstanding food and one hell of a sensory overload. The line outside will be long but it moves really fast. The staff, while in a rush remain delightful and engaged. If driving, good luck. We used an under the building public lot on Rue Saint Cuthbert and paid a reasonable rate for a 24 hour stall. All side dishes are sized to share and they do not take credit. I'm odd in this way but I often take note; they may be very small but the washrooms are nice and clean. That's right, up here there are no restrooms, just washrooms or toilets.
Easily met the hype. Just go. Fun fact: Music Sensation, Celine Dion is the owner. She is known for the song "My Heart Will Go On" from the smash hit film "Titanic" starring Billy Zane.

I can only comment on the to-go side and the sandwich as that was all we got. I had heard good things about this place and how Canada is known for smoked meat. I must say the meat was good but the sandwich left much to be desired. It was on loaf bread with mustard. I understand you go for the meat and a lot of meat was on it (as it should of been for $10) but I think if I did go back I would try there plates of food. I wish the sandwich has more sauce on for me personally because it was a little hard to eat with the bread. The meat was good but don't go too far out of your way for this sandwich. I will say the line was long but very fast they move you through quick. The service was not the greatest but the food was not bad .

Getting yelled at for walking into a restaurant is always awesome. Customers should come with psychic abilities on point so they know the amorphous group of people standing outside are a line and that behind the front door lies an angry dad man. To make matters worse, the smoked meat was dryer and less succulent than I had previously experienced. I had loved this place but given the recent experience, and the inconsistent food, I think I'll stick with Lester's in Mile End.

Didn't know much about smoked meat. Upon first bite it reminded of dry corned beef.Schwartz's is best known for their smoked meat and no visit to Montreal can go escaped without a meal here so I've heard. Popped in at 1:30PM and had to wait 15 minutes for a seat on a Wednesday. Two smoked meat sandwiches, a black cherry soda, and an order of poutine came with a pickle (~30).Had to add more mustard to the sandwich. Wasn't really a fan of the food. The smoked meat just didn't seem worth even the short wait, hype, or even price. Service was friendly and fast. I bet the two guys who sat next to us were pissed we got our food first since we ordered after them. Cash only with the option of "leaving something extra" for your server. The menu placement doesn't say anything about price, you have to squint at the sparse menu above the counter to get an idea.

Bad service ever! Will never come again! Even didn't ask how fat I want to have for the meat. Taste is just soso...I just bring my parent here but the service makes them feel disappointed! Not recommend! Save your time and money!

We heard from a number of friends about Schwartz's. Coming from New York, we were skeptical, to say the least. Well we were proven wrong. The smoked meat sandwich was absolutely delicious and the Cole slaw was amazing. Yes, the sandwiches are a little small, but that (and the cheaper price) were actually kind of refreshing in contrast with the massively overwhelming $25 sandwiches we're used to. Overall a great experience with just enough food to keep you happy at a cheap price. Would definitely recommend.

Having lived in Montreal, there are other places where you can get a comparable smoked meat sandwich without having to endure the cramped seating, occasionally long waits, and Quebecois standard of service. However, it's still an iconic place in Montreal, and definitely worth a visit if you've never been. Whenever I go to Montreal with my friends, we always make a visit here, if only to take in the atmosphere and check out the other shops on the street.

An institution of Montreal with a storied past. You should know that the price takes this into consideration.Don't get me wrong, it's delicious and eating here is a quintessential part of a tourist's itinerary. Just know that there is a shop in the same neighborhood that offers a smoked meat sandwich that is just as praise worthy. It's the *main* reason for my score.
Cant visit Montreal without visiting Schwartz's Deli.  Its pretty good.  You will definitely get a ton of food.  You wont leave hungry.  Just my opinion, but I prefer pastrami over the smoked meat

5 stars for the old world charm and experience. This place hasn't been touched since it opened over 80 year ago, making it the oldest in Canada.  They have steaks, turkey and salami, but their smoked meat is the star of the show! Smoked in house, daily, you can order it lean, medium, medium fat or fat on rye bread and mustard. Pickles and coke slaw are served a la Carter and a must order along with their fries. Schwartz's is also credited with creating Montreal steak spice, which you can buy some on your way out. Sometimes there's long lineups, so come off peak times or be prepared to wait. There is a take out shop next door if you don't want to wait. You can also buy a pound or two of their smoked meat to take home with you. Always a good idea. :)

Don't understand the hype! The only thing I really liked was the coleslaw--vinegar-based dressing that was a light refreshing contrast to the smoked meat sandwich that I found meh. Glad we ordered only one!

Woohooo thank you, Merci Jenjen.small dinner that's been opened since the early 20's which used to be Jewish is now a Spanish-Portuguese neighborhood of Montreal.  it's not your prettiest diner, but I consider this place a GEM and a dive all at once.  Why? keeping your classic dishes, well, classic and don't change them.Supposedly Celine DIon is a fan of this place, its no wonder why we all like Schwartz, not because of her, but because of its traditional deli meat sandwiches and pickles it serves.If you're not used to sitting in close spaces beside people or sharing tables, go elsewhere, for food is business..... here's the breakdown:Smoked meat sandwich- Easy 5/5! no shortage of smoked MTL meat in this one.Cornichon- well this is the biggest pickle I've ever eaten, but it was delish! 4.5/5Poutine- It was ....okay..I truly felt I've had better....3/5Black cherry cola- perfect way to wash down my meal and what our waiter recommended. 4/5.Service was efficient!place was somewhat clean....overall experience is a solid 4 out of 5!

The montreal classic: medium cut with a black cherry cola.It's obviously a little overblown: there are other good delis in the city (Lester's, dunn's) but if you're stumbling down St-Laurent and there's no line-up, jump in there.  It's a little expensive for what you're getting though, mostly because it has become a tourist attraction.It is still amazing that this place is STILL CASH ONLY, even after having been purchased by Angelil-Dion.

Over 90 years of history, this legendary place speaks for itself.  If ordering the smoked meat sandwich, ask for medium fat, your palette/taste buds will thank you after.Sandwich is small in size BUT it packs a bunch in terms of meat and taste.  Literally, I felt life is complete after finishing this.  Then the next day, when the Swartz's craving hits but you have already left Montréal.  I can only reminiscent with words and pictures.

Simply WOW!!!!You are greeted with a long wait (up to 30 minutes) outside the shop. Once inside, you are hit with a smell of smoked meat like nowhere else. A host quickly greets you and tries to find you a spot. Tables are communal in a sense that you might share your table with other diners. The host will take your order. They have a variety of different meat cuts: lean, medium and fatty. I would strongly recommend the medium for it has a great balance between tenderness and juiciness. Order it with a Dr. Pepper and a dill pickle and you are set.The sandwich itself is gigantic but my oh my does the meat melt in your mouth; literally! It is so tender that it just disintegrates without any effort whatsoever. The dill pickle gives it a lovely burst of sweet acidic juice that just fills your mouth. Finish it all off with a nice can of Dr. Pepper and you can call it a day.Highly recommend!

Wow this sandwich rocks! As a former New Yorker I thought there was no place that could come close to Katz's, but this sandwich just might be better. There was a huge long line to get in and sit, but we went to the takeout area and sat at the counter and ate in less than 5 minutes, which I recommend

Mediocre smoked meat sandwich as it was quite dry and salami sandwich was nothing special. You can feel the history running through the place and that's the tourist attraction aspect of it. We sat there and ate but there was no air conditioning in the seating area which made it the area feel hot and humid. I would recommend giving it a try if you're in the area, but I personally wouldn't go again. There are two locations side by side, one for "take out" and another for dine in. We chose the take out location.
Smoked meat sandwiches are a must-have if you're in Montreal. To avoid the line out front we got our sandwiches to-go, but they were delicious and definitely stuffed with meat. Highly recommend!!

My friend and I came here when there was no line. We were seated next to another group at a table.  I loved the communal tables because I met some very nice people through this meal.  My friend and I ordered the smoked meat sandwich with a side of hot peppers.  I usually dislike smoked meats because I find this very dry.  Schwartz was the complete opposite.  I found the meat tender and juicy with thin bits of fats.  By the time my friend and I were done, there was a long line outside.  Note: Try to come after the lunch rush (3-4pm) and on a weekday.  This place is cash only.  You can pay in USD but they charge an additional 10%.

New York Jew here! I was really excited to try the Montreal version of one of my favorite foods. The line was kind of long- I waited outside for about 20 minutes in 19 degree F. But once I was inside, I forgot all about it. The sandwich was worth the wait. I ordered it medium, without much fat, but was a little disappointed when bit into chunks but fat in the sandwich.I also got dill pickles (amazing!) and coleslaw (made with a more vinegary base without cream). The coleslaw was ridiculously good.CASH ONLY- be prepared.

Visited for the first time on Good Friday afternoon and waited 25 minutes to be seated. Shorter than expected lineup luckily. Girlfriend and I were seated at the end of the bar counter which was great. More personable experience interacting with the servers by the counter it seemed than sharing a table with other customers behind us. Montreal smokedmeat sandwich with fries along with a cherry cola was so good that we ordered a second sandwich! Food came quickly, tasted great, and had a great classic diner atmosphere inside. Loved the experience! Highly recommend and must visit again!

Wow. If there's one thing you must eat In Montréal it's this. I don't exaggerate when I say this is one of the best sandwiches I've had in my life. Even though it's very simple, the smoked meat melts in your mouth. It has a perfect flavor that's accentuated by the mustard, and doesn't need any other ingredients to spruce it up. At first I wrote Shwartz's off as a lame tourist trap and wasn't even going to stop in. Let me just say I am so, so glad I stopped in and that this is no tourist trap. The smoked meat sandwiches are really just that good. I'm so sad that this place is all the way up in Montréal, if I had one near me I would be there all the time.

Having heard of this place even living from out of province, you know it's a must try! I decided that it was time to finally find this place in the Jewish quarter of Montreal (which seems to be very Portuguese now)It's literally a hole in the wall but it's pretty efficient having take out in one completely separate entrance, and the sit down part in another unit (although it would be nice if they could just combine that all)We got a table right away for 2 on Thursday at 3pm. I had a hard time looking for a menu due to the seat I had but to my embarrassment there were two large wall menus I just didn't bother looking up! It does reduce fumbling in the tight space so that is nice. I did notice the staff were friendly and actually having legitimate conversations with customers which definitely gave the nice cosy family vibe.I had meat sandwich with poutine and a tea. He had meat sandwich with a pickle and black cherry soda. I was super jealous because his juicy pickle went perfectly with the sandwich and the soda was so good!!! Luckily he was willing to share :')Washrooms were clean and surprisingly there was one for each gender considering how small the place was I thought that was impressive! One improvement I have is I wish the bread slices for the sandwich were a bit thicker as I feel like the bread was too soggy due to the amount of meat grease and mustard that fills up the bread.I would come back again to order a meat sandwich, pickle, and black cherry soda. Yum!!!

Best smoked meat ever!! Better get the large smoked meat rather than the sandwich (if you're sharing). It comes with a bread too. Come around the opening time (10.30 am) so you don't have to line up. Cash only if you eat there! But they accept credit cards for the take out.Came here 3 times in a week!! Delicious

[LOCATION] - 3/5Located on Boul St-Laurent and Avenue des Pins. Paid street parking is available outside this place. [SERVICE] - 5/5Our server worked here for 9 or 10 years. He's personable, humourous, and very helpful. [DÉCOR] - 4/5 I felt like I went back in time because there were so many historic pieces to reminisce the highlights of the business since it opened in 1929. [QUALITY] - 3/5Yes, this was a historic place, but I don't think I like the taste of history. The smoked meat was too salty and dry for me. They claimed the smoked meats had a "freshness" but I only tasted spices that marinated the meat. [ORDER] - 3/5- Smoked Meat Sandwich - $9.75: meat was overly spiced and dry, and bread was stale. - Poutine - $6.25: On the bright side, this poutine was pretty good. Fries were made of real potatoes, gravy was nice and rich, and cheese curds melted perfectly. [OVERALL] - 3/5I was not a big fan because I don't enjoy dry and high-sodium food. If you're into that, and you are also a meat-lover, then the Smoked Meat Sandwich would be an ideal choice for you! Note: CASH ONLY

user_city: Lower Nob Hill, San Francisco, CA
user_review: Meat is always delicious and melting in the mouth. Also can recommend pickles and mustard. If u don't want to stay in line you can order food to go.

In montreal so had to try this iconic and timeless institution...Im telling you guys, this place did not dissappointed. The smoked meat here is the best ive ever tasted. Best brisket ever with the perfect combination of meat and fat. One bite and its pure meat heaven. Nicely stacked and juicy ....worth the visit for sure. Place gets packed easily and tables are cramped...one of the servers acts as a bouncer/front office manager and yells "how many?" As you walk in the door. Typical butcher with a white.apron and shirt and belly....lol. The place is so rustic...white boards with the menu and serving only beef , turykey or chicken...no table.orderd chicken while i was there..lol. I did not order anything else..as i didnt wanna compromise the taste and ruin the experience..A must try for sure for everyone coming to montreal...

As an American, I can't believe I'm saying this but Smoked Meat greater than Pastrami. This place is one of the most nostalgic slices of history I ever walked into. It so wonderfully tapped into my Jewish roots. And the staff is super cool and super hilarious. I got the large plate. Slaw. Pickle. And a stack of rye bread, and a Canadian cherry coke (forgot the name). The world could have been on fire outside, it wouldn't have mattered. I was not moving from my chair until I was finished. I was in Jewish Deli BLISS!!! Do not! I repeat DO NOT LEAVE MONTREAL without eating here. I hope this place stays in business forever. Fortunately, I think it will.

Amazing smoked meat sandwiches but you probably already knew that. The restaurant is small and you will be seated next to strangers but that's what gives this place its character and homey feel. Definitely show up here hungry and with some time to spare for waiting in line.
Nothing changed since the begining of the 20th century. Same smoked meat, great smoked meat.

We had 7 ... 4 gals and 3 guys. It was suggested that we order 2 of each : large medium meat platter, pickles, slaw and fries. They gave us tons of bread but those platters were very large at all...wasn't really enough for us. Overpriced for sure, lacked flavor and was kinda dry. Also prefer spicy as opposed to crappy yellow mustard which they don't have. Fries weren't crisp or hot, and slaw isn't creamy. Perhaps I am just spoiled by Katz' Deli in NYC.

The short: Great food, great service. What else can you ask for.The long: line up for the diner was so long I decided to go to the deli side instead. The servers and cashiers were fast and friendly. I bought a a couple pounds of meat along with everything else to make the sandwiches at home along with a couple of poutines. The food was amazing and relatively cheap. Amazing experience overall and will definately visit this place again next time I'm in the city.
Untasty and dry smoked meat. Although staff is nice, the food does not deserve the hive or the price. Go to the Mains or Reubens!

I waited in line for a hot minute ( And I literally mean hot. If I had stayed in that line I would have melted. Or at least fainted and suffer some dehydration.) before popping in through the take-out door. I was in and out in 15 minutes (Give or take). The dine in line barely move when I got out. Across the street was a cut out shipping container turned into seating area. Perfect place to get out of the sun to eat my sandwich. The sandwich was pretty good. Little bit too fatty for my liking. I won't be surprised if I develop a zit or two come tomorrow. Sorry TMI. Overall the meat was good quality and delicious. That bread though was not substantial enough to hold all that meat in.

I tried the meat a few times due to peer pressure but there is just no flavour in the meat, which, although tender, tasted like tasteless stew meat to me. If you want good smoked meat, go across to the street to Main's or if you're downtown, Reuben's is also good.
The smoked meat is exceptional . Their service however is really lacking . Go there early for lunch and you avoid the lines. We were there at noon and by 12:30 there was a line .

Don't hate me but I feel like the quality has dropped over the years. What used to be a warm Montreal deli has turned into cold one. When I remember going to Schwartz's I remember warm meat, Spicy mustard and fresh bread. Somehow, my expectations were not met. I was served a cold meat sandwich, regular mustard and a complete lack of standards. I'm heartbroken - this business that was at the top of the game about a decade ago and I sense it's is going to fail. Hence the increased prices, lower quality products and overall crappy service. I'm so sorry to say this but I'm sad. Super sad that this institution is going to die. Lower the prices, rely on less tourists, improve the quality of food served - and voila - you've got a viable business model again.

Been going to Schwartz's since I was a kid. Even though I left Montreal almost 30 years ago I still stop by every visit. The smoked meat is flawless. Try their green  tomatoes, they add to the experience.
Schwartz is the king of Montreal Smoked Meat. If you can only hit one Smoked Meat shop then pick Schwartz.
We did  a late night stop, no lines! Which is a miracle. The smoked meat is AMAZABALLS!!!! Ended up ordering 3 smoked meat sandwiches. Truly one of a kind, GO!

This is the kind of place that makes grown men cry.  When we arrived, the wait was not too bad, shortly after we arrived the line got really long though.  The staff was friendly and welcoming, even joked around with us!  It was awesome, even though the place is small, we was able to squeeze 11 guys in!This is the best smoked meat I had when in Montreal, maybe even ever..  the meat was so succulent and flavorful!  I enjoyed the medium fat more than the lean fat, I felt like it was more juicy and flavorful.  Some of the guys did half and half and thought it was perfect.  I did a sandwich and the guys did a large plate of meat to share.  Both are easily enjoyable, just don't forget to wash it down with the black cherry soda!I would come back to Montreal just for this!

I enjoyed my visit to Schwartz's but I'd rather be at Katz's in the lower east side or the late, lamented Carnegie Deli. Don't get me wrong: the smoked meat (stateside we'd call it pastrami) is excellent though the choice of whether to serve you lean, fatty or in between seems to be dictated more by what's on the end of the roast than special pieces the carver has put aside. But I wanted some spicy mustard, a slice of cheese for my sandwich and a wider choice of sides and those things were missing. Still felt like I'd taken a few months off my life eating a small sandwich, so I guess I shouldn't complain.Fun fact: on an early evening in February, fully half the diners were Chinese. Not Chinese-Canadian or Chinese-American but Chinese-Chinese, some wearing garb from mainland Chinese colleges.

Wow. This place. Before this place, I thought, I really don't like a lot of meat. This meat to bread ratio looks like not my style. But when in Montreal...I told my boyfriend that I'd split a sandwich with him and it was honestly the worst decision I've ever made because after the first bite, and a few breaths of disbelief I realized that I wanted at least 6 more of the sandwich that was in front of me. Wow. Just wow. I still pretty much think of this juicy stack of meat every day since I had my half sandwich. And the service was great as well, and hilarious. Definitely got picked on in a fun way for sharing one sandwich. We went during the week around late lunch time and there was no line and a decent amount of seats to dine in!

There's a tiny section of Montreal that made me feel like I was in the LES of Manhattan. It's filled with classic delis that serve those iconic piled high sammies you need at least two sittings to finish. Apparently this is THE must stop for smoked meats and classic Jewish fare in the area. We arrived early in the morning and there was the start of a line. If you come before 10am they will not sell you hot meat and that was somewhat of a bummer for hubs as he was really looking forward to a Rueben not just a cold corned beef on not toasted rye. It was huge and priced appropriately for size. He said it was pretty good, not outstanding. I honestly think he was just disappointed that he wasn't able to get what he was really looking for. We also bought one of each of their mustards to bring home to family and house rub. All were absolutely incredible as was the single large kosher dill I couldn't resist. Definitely grab some bottles to go!!! When these are done, I'm calling to figure out how to get more. They're insanely delicious! Best mustard ever! I say give it a go but get there right at 10am to avoid long lines and if you want a hot sandwich. Unmetered street parking was easy to find earlier in the morning, but I can see it may become and issue later in the day.

Recommended by a friend before visiting Canada, we visited the place, it has a nice ventage look, we did not stay to eat inside as we had other plans which worked fine for us as they had long waiting line, so we picked a sandwich and ate on our way, it was up to the expectation and definitely I will recommend friends to go there.

FABULOUS! I don't wait in lines for restaurants, but this was worth the 1/2 hour wait. Uncomfortable seating,& you're sitting with strangers ( like Katz's in NYC). Unlike Katz's, this deli is worth the hassle.

I came to Schwartz's based on all the fantastic reviews. I ordered the smoked meat sandwich which was good (compared to others that I've had), BUT it was $14 CDN for a sandwich and a drink. Too expensive for a tiny sandwich. Yes, it's a lot of meat but both me and my boyfriend were still hungry after we each ate one ourselves. If I added a pickle and fries it would have been over $20 CDN. The meat was tender and fell apart instantly, but there was no real flavour and I definitely needed more mustard. Overall, it was okay, but I don't think I would come back though.

First of all let me start by saying that this place is a tourist grab. I was in the city from Toronto and thought of visiting here. I ordered a sandwich, poutine and a coke. The sandwich was just mediocre and is pretty oily and bland. Poutine was the second worst I've ever had in Canada after wild wings poutine. Thankfully Coke was normal. If you want to ignore my review and still want to check this place out, please bring some cash to avoid getting ripped for another $1.50. Ahhh.... don't forget to put tip in the jar at the front counter or the lady at the cash will remind you of it very nicely :p

Already so much as been said about Schwartz's - I won't dwell too long on it.Just stay clear of peak hours, its a nightmare to wait in line for food like that.I've been there twice only because it takes some time to get the food and it's not cheap at all. But it's worth it to at least try once! You can choose between different fattiness levels of the meat, which is nice.
Best smoke meat in Montreal, you need to take away for avoid the line up but  you will never be disappointed

Definitely not worth the wait if the line is down the block but it's not too bad if you can walk right in and sit which happened to me the other day which was a first in years. Would definitely recommend the smoked meat sandwich which is similar to Katz deli in NYC but they get offended when you tell them their meat is basically Pastrami. Their Cole slaw is pretty good as well if you want some condiments on the side.

Eveyrone gets the smoked meat sandwich. You can absolutely taste the flavor and the French fries are crispy to accompany your meal. Don't skip on the mustard. The Cole slaw is on the acidic side but interesting to try something new. Might be an overkill if you're already getting the pickles which are delicious.

I came here while in town with my husband on our "mini-moon".  We took a food tour through Airbnb and this was one of the stops.  The sandwich was good but pretty standard.  The pickles are definitely worth trying as well.  Seems to be a Montreal staple so I definitely recommend giving this place a shot if you're visiting from out of town.

Yes, I know it's a Montréal institution, and yes, I know you just have to try out some places because you just have to try out some places, but I just didn't get the hype that surrounds Schwartz's and their 'viande fumée'.I got the smoked meat sandwich (medium fat), and it really didn't have much flavor, other than just tasting like a pile of meat. While tender, there was no real spice or seasoning coming through, and the smoking process interestingly didn't really enhance the flavor of the meat. The rye is good but doesn't really hold up to the meat, with the sandwich falling apart once you get about half-way through. The fries are an afterthought for the kitchen, lukewarm and more limp than crisp - don't bother.What *is* impressive is how quickly they can turn customers here - I was seated at the counter and was in and out in less than 15 minutes, a veritable turnstile. Based on my own experience, my guess is that Schwartz's is resting on its laurels a bit, knowing that the tourists will be coming by given its long history. IMHO, the delis in New York have nothing to worry about.

What hasn't been said, written or discussed about them. I mean this is like review 10,000...It's the first thing someone says when you get off the plane, train or bus in Montreal, "make sure you go to get Schwartz's". With that in mind they're done a pretty good job of keeping it real despite the-times-they-are-a-changing...They still smoke their own meat in house (and that's a big deal especially with how much they serve), and after trying many other around the city they are and will continue to be the unique one of the bunch. Their meat and the ambiance can't really be compared - mustard and meat juiced hands down. The staff have an amazing camaraderie that is very hard to come by in today's world of high turn over restaurant staff. Obviously this place has gotten and continues to get a lot of hype. One the owners is just a tad well known around the world, and yes I'm a fan. Go Celine go.Huge shout out to the manager, head slicer and staff for being there day in and day out. Even when they could have an attitude of smoked meat 'kindomship', or old school arrogance, they are respectful and humble.A lean to medium-fat sandwich with a bottle of mustard in one hand, and a Cott black cherry soda in the other - it's a treat and an experience that I still enjoy ... My Expos cap off to them.

Iconic Montreal restaurant. After living in Montreal for over 24 years, I finally decided that it was time. Time to go to this famous smoke meat place. One of the reasons that I did not go to this restaurant earlier in my life includes different reasons, but mainly the fact that I only tasted mediocre smoke meat sandwiches so far in my life. Needless to say, my expectations were pretty high for Schwartz.I went there on a winter evening with some friends during a weekday. Fortunately, there was only a very small line and we were seated fairly quickly. The decor of the restaurant itself looks very vintage, almost as like they did not change anything since their opening. As for the food itself, the price tags are pretty high considering their portions (around 10$ for a smoke meat sandwich if I am not mistaken). That being said, the sandwich itself was decent, but definitively nothing to hype about. As I am not a big fan of salty meals, this is definitively not in my alley. Unfortunately, Schwartz was not able to convert me into smoke meat
Really love the number four sandwich. It tasted great with the yellow mustard. Black Cherry Soda was good too. Special in Montreal.

Normally, we love your smoked meat.  On our last trip to Montreal we stopped at your shop and purchased several packages of your sliced meat.  The package we opened up last night was horrible!  Tough as leather and turned my husband right off.  Being from Verdun, he so looks forward to his trip to Montreal,  the only thing good about this trip was the steamie we had at Periettes Patates on Rue Verdun!
If you are in the need of a fast and delicious sandwich go no further! Always a line but the best smoked meat sandwiches in town! Well worth it and never disappoints

Must try in Montreal! Service and food was amazing. We shared the smoked meat sandwich (choice between fatty, medium, lean- we opted for medium) as we were already quite full. The bread was soft with a thin mustard spread, and a generous heaping of quarter pound of smoked meat sandwiched in between. Simple and delicious! You can also order additional smoked meat by weight which was what we did, this time opting for a mix of the  fatty and medium. Wow, the fatty smoked was perfection-super juicy and well seasoned. Obviously, we paired it with a pickle and a cherry coke for tradition's sake. Service was amazing!  Efficient, they know what they're doing and our server had a lovely radio voice. We loved it!  Also, don't forget to walk down to Ana's bakery to end your meal with a sweet pastry!TIP: we came at odd hours, before dinner and it was raining. We did not have to wait for a table!

oh man was this place oh oh so delicious.  I wanted another sandwhich after I finished mine.  There will be a line out the door.  I recommend to go to the Takeout Section which is in the store next to it, and you won't have to wait in line. In the takeout section, they also have seating in the back via bar stools.   We got the smoked meat sandwich $9.75 and it was so good! All the meat were fresh! The sandwiches are quite large so be prepared to share or be extremely hungry.  We would definitely have come back b/c it was just that delicious but there was too many places to eat at and too many things to see.

Been coming here since I was a kid. Honestly, people can debate smoked meat vs. NY pastrami, but Schwartz has my vote! Montreal has many great smoked meat places, but Schwartz will always have a special place in my heart. It's true that the meat tends to be a little dry compared to others, but that what I like. The spices are just right and the smoked meat always fresh. Not to mention all the must-have sides here are great: pickles, fries, coleslaw and a cherry coke! Pure perfection.

BEST BRISKET PERIOD!!!!Melt in your mouth with that extra layer of fat that trickles down the corner of your lips. Recommendation: use the take out line instead of eating in house. There are bar stools at the back for you to sit on even in take out. Bring an umbrella if you want to line up outside for the whole experience.

First time in Montréal. See review to try this must do place. We arrived at 2:00, still wait for like 30mins. However the wait time is totally worthy. The smoked meat sandwich is so juicy and tender. There are a lot of meat in the sandwich which it's kind of important to eat only by hand. But it feel so light after you ate. Well seasoning and not heavy at all. You can totally taste the good quality in your mouth. Poutine is very good too. The gravy is very smooth with cheese. It looks like a very easy dish, but don't know why NY never have it. Such an amazing experience. Food serve super quick. And great service from the bar. The worker explain to us how the quality is maintained.It's a cash only place for dine in. Credit cards are only accepted in take out store which is next to the main restaurant.

First day in Montreal, had to try the infamous Schwartz. I came late so there wasn't much of a line. I got in by 12:40am (places closes at 1:30am) and was told there was no more sit-in and that they only had take-out smoked meat sandwiches left. Well, thats not a problem since the menu is very small. I felt the service was a bit rude and pushy, especially if you couldn't speak fluent french. I've had better service at a Chinese restaurant where waiters don't get the tip.The place inside is a bit scrunchy and dirty. Tastewise the smoked meat sandwich is quite delicious! Dunn's is more fatty and moist, while Schwartz has a bit of a crisp texture to it but is more dry. Service- 1/5Atmosphere- 2/5Cleanliness- 2/5Food- 5/5Price/value- 4/5Would i return? Yes, for take-out
You will have to line up. You will love the food ( if you like meat, of course ). You will have crossed off a Montreal must- do! Enjoy!
Love the food. A tiny place, but the smoked meat is great. Totally recommend trying this place out
This was one of the best meals we had in Montreal! It is very rich and filling so sharing one sandwich worked for us! Totally worth the long wait and you are served within seconds of sitting down.

The classic smoked meat deli in Montreal. It was fantastic! Of course, I ordered the smoked meat sandwich. It was DELICIOUS. Even the pickle on the side was amazing. Limited menu, but they do it right!There isn't much seating, it's a small place not meant for large groups. The service is quick and I was impressed the constant changing of hungry to satisfied customers.If you visit Montreal, you owe it to yourself and tastebuds to come here.

As someone who doesn't care much about sandwiches, I was a bit skeptical coming to try the FAMOUS MOST DELICIOUS Sandwich in Montreal.... But I was proven wrong!!!! Check out my experience on video youtu.be/Q186qvy7c3II was worried that there would be a long line as everyone I talked to, yelp and Trip Advisor mentioned how crazy the line at any given time! We arrived a little bit past 5pm and there was a short line of 3 people... the inside looked different than the photo too... later I realized WE WERE at the to-go spot ahahahah!! Well, no worry!!! Shorter line and there are seating areas in the back!!! Yes, counter seatings only but hey, we pretty much had the whole area for ourselves!! (well, there were a couple others who joined us later on).We ordered two smoked meat sandwiches.. one medium fat and one fatty!!! Yes, choose how lean/fat your meat... 1 Regular poutine to share and we also grabbed a couple of Cherry Sodas from the fridge per other reviewers' recommendation. Total 38 CAD!The order came out FAST! We had to wait 5 minutes for the poutine...Poutine was amazing!!! the cheese was gooey and stringy.. yummmmmm!!!!! they were generous with the gravy too OMG!!!! flavor explosion in my mouth!!! A bit salty but yummmmmmm :)The smoked meat sandwiches.. o gosh!!! I was so worried it would be wayyyy too salty.. but one bite and I was in smoked meat heaven!!! Both hubby and I preferred the fatty meat as it was juicier.. you need that little bit of fat to enjoy life! It wasn't overly fatty.. no worry!! Washed it down with the "oh-so-refreshing" cherry soda!! BAM!!!! amazing simple meal!!! So so so so so good!!!If you visit Montreal, come here to check it out!!! They dosed each sandwich with lots of meat.. so you could even order extra slices of bread to make more sandwiches! so so so so good and memorable!

OK, this is famous but I really don't see why it is famous.   Really, food is not exceptional.   We got the smoked meat sandwich and the liver platter.   The famous smoked meat sandwich is like a normal pastrami sandwich.   Maybe a better pastrami or reuben sandwich will probably be better.

When visiting Montreal, one must have a Smoked Meat Sandwich. The place to get one is Schwartz's. My friends and I visited the small deli for an early dinner a few weeks ago. The deli was completely full but we only waited about 15 minutes for a seat. This is a sandwich one dreams about. The meat was perfectly tender, smokey and flavorful. Be aware the deli is cash only. I plan to be back next time I'm in Montreal.
Very good i love the food . It's expensive but that's okay .My meal was great. I waited for quite the time for it to arrive but it was worth the wait.
Great place to eat. Food is fresh, great employees, clean joint, and best poutine and smoked meat away from all the tourist places in town!
-probably one of the most authentic smoked meat in Montreal-Everything is fresh and the service is friendly-grab medium fat-a bit pricy but definitely worth it

Visiting from Vancouver, we had to do the touristy thing and try the smoked meat we've all heard about. I ordered what was recommended and was so happy I did! Get the poutine, get the pickles, get the medium lean sandwich and don't forget your cherry coke. You will leave a happy camper.

HONESTLY this place is nothing crazy. Literally just smoked meat and bread....I didn't want to try since I knew this place was probably overhyped but I felt like leaving Montreal without trying Schwartz's would be equivalent to me going to Boston and not trying their clam chowder. If you are visiting Montreal yes you should definitely come here but do know you are just joining the hype movement.
Service is Suck, we order and paid for on the phone but when we arrive they said it's already sold. Don't know why everyone give 4 stars, must be same family?
Everything everyone says it is. Super simple smoked meat sandwich that was to die for. Our waiter was a character in the good way. Looking forward to coming back.

It's the one and only holy Grail and most sought after place to have smoked meat. On a recent trip in May I brought some out of towners who wanted to eat here. Let's get things straight. Yes it's a small place and they can boss you around as a patron(like a bistro in Paris). You order lean or medium fat. Lean is dry in my opinion (need the extra mustard to choke it down) and medium is what you want to get if you want flavour. On our visit the service was very cordial polite and one of the guys working says they go through around 2000lbs of brisket a day there. That's a lot of beef. However this is the place to come in MTL and the tourists love it up. In Montreal you can get smoked meat at pretty much any sandwich shop in town. Heck, across the street is the Main, Ruebens on St Catherine or Snowdon Deli, smoke Meat pete's (Ile Perrot) all serve it up quite well. My favourite is in Laval at George's.  Schwartz's did deliver for my out of town guests and I was mildly impressed. I've eaten here probably six times in 10+ years. This visit sure impressed them and that's what counts. My sandwich was decadent and delish as usual. I wouldn't wait more than 20 minutes for a table here but lineups are quite common. On our visit we lucked out big time to get a table very quickly. Great place to bring out of towners but I don't plan to go back unless I have to!

Montreal's smoked meat - the city's signature dish. One of the places to eat at is of course Schwartz's Deli, where the brisket is brined for up to 1O days in savoury spices and then smoked for hours. The place is always packed at any hour. It is a small place and you will be sharing table with others and sitting shoulder to shoulder. As for the meat, you can order it on a scale of lean to fat. The first plate we ordered is the fat one. It certainly is fatty dan juicy but it might be too fatty for some people. The next plate we ordered is medium fat. It is a bit leaner but is still juicy. A mix of fatty and medium fat would be the perfect combination.

This is another must eat in Montreal, reminds me a lot of Katz deli in NYC.  The house specialty is the smoke meat sandwich.  The wife and I ordered a sandwich each an then we shared a pickle, side of coleslaw and had a cherry soda each.  This was recommended by the staff.  The food is good and the sandwiches are big.  Keep in mind that this place does not take credit, cash only, so if you need money, there is a bank atm right across the street.  Overall the meal came out to $40 which is not cheap, luckily this was all I had in my wallet so I didn't have to hit up the atm until after we left the restaurant.

A true Montreal landmark! Smoked meat sandwich was to die for, and make sure to get the pickle. The service was fast and courteous. Place was crazy packed and be prepared to sanitize in line to get in. Regardless, the wait is more than worth it!
Montreal food landmark for years but prices are way out of hand $12 for sandwich is overpriced!!!

OVERRATED is the BEST word to describe shwartz's!!!! If you want to wait an hour in the cold outside on the streets for a smoke meat sandwich that taste bland and unappealing you can but if you're looking for a better joint for smoke meat sandwiches there are so many better places. Montreal is the Mecca of smoke meat sandwiches! Reuben's on st-catherine's is one of the best places to get smoke meat !! Or if you're in laval : George's is also amazing. Ok back to shwartz's .. it's overrated for many reasons 1st: the service is a mess... they really don't give a shit about customer service. They treat you like garbage. They just want you out the door. There's hardly any seats and your squished to eat your meal with people who look greasy. Your appetite is practically gone when you look at who's eating there. 2) the only reason they are so packed and famous is for the tv shows and the fact that Celine Dion is associated with them.3) the smoke meat is really gross and rubbery! Overall, avoid thinking its good smoke meat.. there's : The main accross the street that offers way better service and way better smoke meat You're welcome :)

Don't stand in line like a tourist, go to the take out counter like a local. Smoked meat sandwiches (medium lean) are out of this world. I drown mine in mustard, in little bottles at the bar seating area. Always get a pickle for the side. Not cheap, but so worth it.

4.5 stars Likes:- Don't know if I have had a smoked meat sandwich as good as this one before.Not a fan of:- It seems like no matter what time you visit, there is a lineup. On a brighter note, the restaurant is decent in size and service is quick and efficient, although you do feel slightly rushed. Definitely not a place for long conversations.- It's not cheap, but well worth it.This is a solid smoked meat sandwich. I am not a meat lover, but I still thoroughly enjoyed my experience here. The beef brisket was tender and seasoned just enough to let the meat flavours shine through. Their own blend of steak seasoning was delicious and I enjoyed the extra punch from the mustard. If you don't specify your preference, you will be served a medium cut, which has a decent amount of fat. I didn't try the fatty cut here, but I did have it at Smoke's Meat Pete, and I must say, go for the fatty cut. I was on cloud nine as the  juicy meat just melted in my mouth. Their cole slaw is extremely fresh from the continuous table turns and complements the fatty sandwich well, although it is a tad too tangy. I avoid sugary drinks in my regular diet, but my husband insisted on getting the cherry coke as it goes well with the smoked meats. I can't say I loved the combination, but I may have been biased seeing that there was over 40 grams of sugar in that one can.Overall, this may be the best smoked meat sandwich I have had, although I do find it a tad pricey for what you get. This was our second meal, so we ordered one sandwich to share, a side of cole slaw, a huge pickle with a cherry soda. It came to about $24 with tax and tip.

came here because it's a must in montreal. the line was extremely long (so make sure you really fill up your parking meter) but honestly this place is worth it! there are TWO lines so make sure you wait in the right line. the sandwiches were absolutely delicious -my family and I got the large plate smoked meat as well as the chicken combo. the chicken was a little bit dry but with the sauce on the side, it made up for it. the space is cute and the service is pretty fast (I didn't like the black cherry soda but hey! if you want to try it, you can! ) overall, definitely was a fan of this place and HIGHLY recommend it if you're in the area!

Smoked. Meat. Heaven. Just, wow. As a NY native, Katz's is considered the holy grail, but after having Schwartz's, I can say I've had one of the best. I was warned Schwartz's is a tourist trap, and for good reason. The meat is flippin amazing! Definitely lives up to the hype. The lines can get long. I was lucky enough to notice the smaller, take out version of their establishment next door did not have a line. Went right in and got my sandwich without a wait. Within 30 minutes, the line for that place was tremendous as well. The meat literally melts in your mouth. You barely have to chew. I like mine on the fattier side and asked for the fatty cuts, but their meat is so tender I don't think it needed the extra fat. The rye bread is kind of an afterthought that holds all the meaty heaven in place. Mustard is much needed to cut through the richness. They're pretty generous with their portions. I'd totally wait in line for another one of these babies.
the smoked meat is extremely thick ，satisfied!However, I don't like the black cherry , taste like kind of medicine.

Fantastic smoked meat sandwiches! This small deli is a must-visit gem of Montreal, everyone loves Schwartz's..even Celine Dion. Service is incredibly quick and friendly. I recommend getting the fries and pickles with your sandwich.

There's only so many places still around like this, and they should be treasured.Sure it's crowded, and you may need to share a table with strangers like I did. And sure it's touristy and there is a line all the time... But it's an institution that has been around a long time and will hopefully be for a many years more.The food is good, and the prices are reasonable. When it comes to the smoked meat sandwich you have a choice between lean or regular with more fat. If you want it to be moister don't go with the lean but either I'm sure tastes great. When I was there we got a fries to share, and also a pickle to share which I think was a good call. The pickles are big and the fries are enough for two people to share. The other big thing there is to get a cherry soda. So do yourself a favour and get a smoked meat sandwich, some fries and ketchup, some pickle and a cherry soda and you'll be good to go

What a tourist trap.Listen, hey, if you haven't been to a good Jewish deli in your life, sure, maybe this place blows you away.  The smoked meat sandwich tastes good, but it's not the life changing experience travel blogs and reviews here make it out to be.  I've had way better.Then, the service is curt because they want you in and out of there as fast as possible.  That's fine, I get it, but then you want a tip?  I get friendlier service at McDonald's.But what really fries my latkes is their tax-evading, cash-only policy.  I don't like using cash, especially as an American tourist.  My entire trip, this was the only occasion where I couldn't use my credit card.  I didn't know they were cash-only until after I ate, so I had to use their ATM, which of course they charge a fee to use.  So not only did I get to pay them a fee to use their ATM, but then I was stuck with leftover Canadian Monopoly money.

I never understood why everyone made such a big deal about eating smoked eat in Montreal, and now that I've had it, I UNDERSTAND. I came here twice in my short trip because it is just THAT good. My personal suggestion is to get it medium fat with a side of pickles. The pickles compliment the fat perfectly! I waited about 30-45 minutes when I came for dinner but had no wait at all when I came for lunch, so I would highly suggest coming at odd hours. But regardless the wait was well worth it! The meat is SO incredible and honestly I can't explain it to you, you just have to come try it for yourself.

The only reason they didn't get the much coveted and elusive 5-star rating from me was the fuckin wait. You know how I hate that. But, I DEFINITELY give them 4 & 3/4 stars. This place is little more than a hole in the wall that has been doing ONE THING to PERFECTION since Rueben Scwarts first open its doors waaaaay back on December 31st, 1927. The Romania smoking techniques have been passed down and unchanged since. This place is small, tight and no frills. The flatware, cups, plates and placemats are all basic but that's not why people wait in line through rain, snow, Sharknado's what the fuck ever. The food is good, decadent and filling. If your on a diet, dont even bother coming here. I has the number 4 with fries. A Reuben on rye with a side of fries. It was magical.

Hmmm. I might need to give this place another try. The sandwich that was given to me was not even warm. I think this definitely changed the texture and quality of the smoked meat that I ate. It was dry and not that flavorful. The amount of meat was adequate for the price and I would've loved to eat more if I had more stomach space!This is a small shop and I was confused of how to order. Just wait for them to let you know you can sit down and they have waiters around that will take your order. They serve it pretty quickly afterwards because the smoked meat is already done. They just toast some bread and slather some mustard on it then bring it to you.I enjoyed the Cole slaw. It was perfectly seasoned and complemented well with the smoked meat.

Amazingly delicious!!! We went on a Saturday evening around 7pm, and waited outside for just five minutes. The store is not very spacious, but the food is so good!! Smoked meat sandwich is no doubt a must-try!! The poutine is normally good. Definitely would visit this place again.

Don't know what else to say that hasn't been already, but this is by far the tastiest smoked meat sandwich I've ever enjoyed. It's only competition is Katz in NYC, but even then I think this comes out on top. Go carry out if you are looking for quick service!!

This place is literally down the block from the Air Bnb I'm staying at. At first I thought it was a long wait because there is a lot of people waiting outside. Luckily the line was for people who wanted to eat in. There is another entrance for people who wants to take out.I got the smoked meat sandwich and it was very delicious. This place is known for it's smoked meat sandwiches. The sandwich is packed with meat and it melts in your mouth. If you are ever in Montreal, you should definitely check this place out!

True to its TV fame (I first saw this place when Anthony Bourdain ate here on one of his shows) this place is PACKED - I luckily found a bar seating for dinner.Interestingly enough, an American couple next to me tipped me off saying "Just get whatever he tells you to get, don't ask anything!" as the server guy walked by with stoic expression. So what choice did I have? The guy asked if I want the same (as the couple) and I went "Yeah."Turns out it's Smoked Meat sandwich, dill pickle, french fries, and cherry coke. A lot of food!The sandwich is just... perfect. So simple but ... so good! When it started being a bit dry their fries and pickle helped. Fries... were the kind of magic fries that are amazing even if soggy... I gather prob due to extra amount of grease? I did not want to know but I ate every last scrap because that fry was EXZCELLENT~ Pickle was good but at $2 CAD... Well. Cherry coke is a MUST with this meal. One downside was that I found out later that this is all cash and I obviously hadn't even calculated the total upon ordering! I was $5 short in CAD, but cashier allowed me to pay the rest in USD, which they penalize you a bit against the CAD. Overall, I spent $20 CAD - so while a bit expensive, it was a lot of satisfying greasy bites. This one is an easy 5-star.

We went there because it is a popular place and you here about it a lot. To be honest, I don't quite get what is so special about it, though smoked meat for pretty good (I wouldn't give it 5 stars though), and we got lucky where we waited outside for maybe 5 minutes at most.

I absolutely love this place. I go every time I'm in Montreal. The line at the restaurant is insane often spilling out the door and down the block however *TIP* they have a "to-go" restaurant right next door that has ample bar seating. I love the simple menu sticking to the roots of this place. They sell a simple smoked meat sandwiches and you can add mustard and a pickle if you want. The sides are straight forward to: coleslaw, fries, poutine... I can't emphasize how refreshing it is to see a straight forward menu!The sandwich: blows NYC Jewish pastrami out of the water!!! The meat is moist, not salty, with a crispy edge... Mmmm ... It's so amazingly fatty it sticks to your ribs so have it early enough that you can make it to your dinner reservation.Go! Don't think about it!
The more u wait the tastier it become....melts like butter make sure to ask for medium to indulge in the taste of authenticity...subjective of course....

This place was recommended to me by a few locals I met while looking for a bite to eat. They said that this is a must go to place if you are in Montreal.They're known for their smoked meat sandwich here which come with three different levels of fattiness- Lean, Medium, and Fatty. According to the locals, you're supposed to get the Medium smoked meat sandwich, fries, and the sides of dill pickle, hot peppers and black cherry cola on the side.Even though I don't have much experience with smoked meat, I have to say I had a very good experience there. The sandwich was on point with the medium fattiness. The hot pepper and dill pickle really compliments the smoked meat well, and the cherry coke just washes everything down perfectly. This is the must get combo if you come here.Also, I heard that this place hasn't changed much since the 1940's. So if you want to experience some traditional Canadian eats, check this place out.

Visiting from Toronto and waited in line but it was worth the wait. Best smoked meat sandwich I've ever had! first time but will be back someday soon! Service was fast and efficient and they regularly keep people in line updated/informed on time to wait, open tables, etc. great spot!

This was on the list of must try things when I came to visit Montreal. There is two doors one for eating in and one for take out. There was a line for eating there and so I decided to get take out instead (there was a small line for take-out, but the line moved extremely quickly.) I got a smoked meat sandwich and I really wanted to try the smoked meat poutine but it was sold out by the time I got there (2pm). The sandwich was amazing, the meat was flavorful and it was delicious. I did not actually try anything else on the menu besides the smoked meat sandwich but that itself was definitely worth the trip there!

Even at 12am, all of the seats were taken at the restaurant. There were 2 stores and was confused on which one to enter. We chose the one with a lot of traffic. Inside, the restaurant was cramped, old and there was still a line up to order, although not as bad as I heard in the middle of the day. My sister and I was not sure how to order anything; the menu was all over the place. we decided that a smoked meat sandwich was enough to go.The sandwich was moist and tasted amazing as reputed. There was a lot of meat in the sandwich.

Please don't waste an hour of your life waiting on line at Schwartz's. I did and regretted it.As a New Yorker raised on deli, I consider myself somewhat of an aficionado.I'm not a NY deli snob. I find Canter's in LA and the late Wolfie's in Miami worthy competitors.  I was therefore going to Schwartz's hoping to enjoy a corn beef on rye and a Knish.After an hour wait with my fellow unsuspecting tourists I finally experienced Montreal's famous Schwartz's. First strike: they charge you per pickle! second strike: no Knishes, third strike: cheap yellow mustard and finally the legendary Schwartz's "smoked meat".  What dreck!  I can only describe the sandwich as rubber on rye.  No briney, smoked flavor,just blah meat.  I ordered a frank from the very limited menu and received a dried up hot dog lying next to a piece of rye.Avoid this tourist trap!

If you plan ahead, and beat the ridiculously long line, you might experience the most flavorful bite of your entire life. The smoked meat sandwich is a fantasy come true. Read about the entire operation on the menu and you'll appreciate each bite. It's delicious with the black cherry cola, dill pickle & slaw on the side. When I was a little girl, I didn't eat meat. The thought of eating an animal freaked me out. The waiter promised my family that if I did like the sandwich, than the meal would be on him. I took a bite and asked for a second sandwich because it was so delicious. That was my first exposure to meat. I always hit up this place whenever I'm in Montreal and so should you!

It's OK. But overrated. The wait does not meet the expectations of all recommendations about such a heritage place.The sandwich was god, but meat little dry.Too noisy,Too small.Of course, you know what you're getting when being there. So, it's just OK, but everybody will say that was amazing because it is fashionable.
It's not very special but you may go for the smoked meat since it's almost a symbol of Montreal. Also, the price is fair so you can have a try.

Have to Go!!!It's a very nice restaurant,which already has over 90 years history.You must to try the smoked meat,and the midsize will be highly recommend ,if you are crazy on enjoying the meat lol.Or if you just want to try it,take the sandwich.It's enough for a person,but the midsize can be share with two person!Believe me try the smoked meat only,and don't forget the pickle!No reservation!Line up everyday!After the meal,you can across the street to try the ice cream!
Worth the wait, great sandwiches. This spot was recommended by someone we met & it did not disappoint.

Yes, it may be an institution, but there are other places in Montreal that have great smoked-meat.We don't go anymore.  Last time we were there......the person cutting the smoked-meat had a really bad cough and was coughing all over the smoked-meat as he was cutting it.  We were grossed out!We never went back after that.

THIS. PLACE. IS. AMAZING. Tip: if you don't mind not having a booth, go to the takeout side and eat at one of the long tables in the back or outside. The line for dine in was SO LONG. We decided to just do takeout and It was super fast. We got the smoked meat sandwich, smoked meat poutine and regular poutine.  I cannot wait for my next trip to Montreal so I can grub on a delicious smoked meat sandwich from Schwartz's!
A Funky Historical landmark/ the greatest smoke meat on the planet! Thank you for the experience

Another Montreal must! Schwartz's is the Katz's deli (in NYC) of Montreal. It's a simple deli that's been around for ages and still only makes the classics. They also sell a variety of seasonings so you can make their classics too. Also important to note, it's a Jewish deli but not a kosher deli. There are two sides - sit down and takeaway. If you're in a rush or it's a nice day, definitely jump on the takeaway line and grab the smoked meat (brisket) sandwich to go. It's a few blocks from Mont Royal Park so you can bring your food there, or find a seat at ledges across the street. I haven't dined in the real restaurant since I have a strong aversion to waiting on lines, but it's the same classics so I'd recommend the take away. The sandwich is simple with just the warm smoked brisket, spiced to perfect, and a touch of mustard. I'm not a huge mustard fan and thought the touch of it was perfect. Enjoy!!

There's a reason the line into this place can often snake down the block- they know what they're doing and they do it well. They don't necessarily do a LOT of things in here- I would never know as there really only one thing I ever order at Schwartz's, and that is the smoked meat sandwich or platter, pickle and black cherry.  Been here 40 times or so and I've never even been tempted to try anything else. People debate about the different smoked meat joints in Montreal, and perhaps Schwartz's popularity has created a bit of a backlash and reviews saying 'it's just ok', but I've tried them all and this place is the ultimate in my humble opinion.

Visited Schwartz's over the Thanksgiving long weekend. According to google and yelp, this was the best place to devour Montreal Smoked Meat. Indeed, this was absolutely true. Their smoked meat was heavenly. We arrived a little after 10am on Thanksgiving day. Walked in and was seated immediately by a man behind the counter. After we sat down, the only waiter in the entire restaurant came by and wanted to take our orders. I asked if I could get a menu because I'm not aware or sure of how to order and exactly what to order. The man rudely said and I quote "there is no menu, we only have smoked meat and we're very well known for that" and he proceeds to point to their wall covered in newspaper clippings of their restaurant. We were already turned off by the rude comment. But we insisted on having smoked meat for brunch. We settled for two Montreal smoked meat sandwiches. These sandwiches were gigantic and beautiful. They are what heaven is made of, i'm sure of it. Fresh bread spread with mustard and filled with so much Montreal Smoked Meat that you totally forget about the bad service. Each bite reminded me that I was closer and closer to finishing my sandwich and that i should probably pace myself. But it was SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOD. Before you knew it, i gobbled up my sandwich in about 10 minutes. Would I be back at Schwartz's? Probably not. I'm sure there are other places that have Smoked Meat at par. To me, customer service is very vital. I'm all about the food, but good customer service goes a long way.

For me personally when a restaurant becomes the Mecca of its own category, it loses its appeal. Is it good because everyone says it's good? Or is it really that good?Economy A: Schwartz's.I sat at the counter and asked for "whatever the locals order", minus the bread, and got the "open face" sandwich, aka a plate of pastrami. Warm, juicy, delicious, and not too salty at all. Was it good enough? Definitely. Good enough to warrant its reputation? No. I think their secret ingredient is nostalgia. Add a pinch of that and suddenly everything becomes magic.

We were skeptical of this place for two reasons: 1 - the disgustingly long line and 2 - the fact that we aren't smoked meat fans. Looking back, both of these were irrelevant. The smoked meat sandwich (10$) was spectacular. Make sure you ask for "medium fat". Really, really good smoked meat, in all its peppery, salty, fatty glory. Would absolutely return. 4.5/5Pro tip - some miss the takeout line, that's much shorter than the restaurant line. Don't miss the takeout line.
Huge and full of tender, juicy flavorful meat! We went in at through the takeout counter and found seats in the back immediately. No waiting! Delicious. Pay street parking.

I love Katz Delicatessen in NYC. So I was a little weary about how this would compare. It did not disappoint! My sister and I went when there was a power outage but that was fine because it wasn't as crowded. We order the smoked meat sandwich with a cherry coke because that's what Anthony Bourdain ordered. It was delicious! Katz and Schwartz are different but I wouldn't be mad about grabbing some Schwartz! The meat was soft and tender, the mustard was subtle, and the bread was phenomenal. The cherry coke was tasty as well. The menu is kind of confusing so if you are like me and don't know what the heck you are doing, just grab a seat and wait for a waiter to come by and take your order.

Schwartz's is famous for their smoked meat sandwich, but to be honest, it's not the best!It's a small hole in the wall place that can mostly fit a maximum of 30 people. There's mostly one thing you want to order, a smoked meat sandwich, if you're in a big group of people, you can order it so that they can give you a few slices of bread and give you your smoked meat on the side, and then you can make your own sandwich. So about the sandwiches, like I said before, it's not the best. It's actually kinda salty in my opinion, but then again, maybe that's how it's supposed to be!?!? I feel like it would be so much better with melted cheese in there!!! It would definitely help with the saltiness of the meat. One sandwich is good enough for me. There are other stuff that you can order, but everyone goes there for the smoked meat. I would recommend going here if you wanna try the "famous smoked meat" but it's mostly all hype to me. But anyways, the reason I'm giving such a high review even for a so-so experience is because our server Eddie was awesome! He was knowledgeable, friendly, and funny! He knew we were from the States so he told us stuff about the restaurant and engaged in some cool conversations with me. Tips:The smoked meat will come as trim, medium fat, or fatty! Get medium or fatty! I actually liked fatty a lot more!

Every single person recommended I check this place out while in Montreal so of course you know I had to!Luckily this was just a few doors down from Big in Japan and it served well for a late night snack!  At around 11:30pm (they close at 12:30am) this place was busy but not packed.  We found a table and I ordered their famous #4.  Smoked meat with mustard.  Simple.  Classic.It took a few short minutes to bring out the sandwich.  It's nothing fancy, a lot of meat (but not so much that you can't fit the sandwich in your mouth), smear of mustard and bread.  But man....it tasted so good.  Juicy and hot - the 2 things I like best in my meat :)   Keeping things simple always is a plus in my books.   I really can't describe in words this place - you just need to come here and try if for yourself.  We did see they had poutine and were tempted to try it but it was late at night and we had already eaten dinner before so we stuck with the classic sandwich.  The place itself looks like a worn out diner, but in a good way.  The menu is simple, the prices are decent and the service is fast.   Order and then pay at the front.

I finally got to experience one of Montreal's iconic food stops. The lineup was a good 15 mins before we were called up to a table of 2. Typical diner style this place was packed. We got acquainted to our seated neighbours, this place is definitely a tourist hub. We ordered the traditional smoke meat sandwich with a side of coleslaw, pickles, fries.
